Develop benefits for employees. Create models for work force strategies.

Name: Perform workforce planning
Element Description: Evaluating the current and future skill requirements of the organization with regard to the overall corporate strategy of the organization and market conditions. Identify and establish the minimum skills needed for the requisite HR needs.

Name: Perform operational workforce planning
Element Description: Determining the requirements for employees and the need for employee resourcing for each every unit/function. Lay out a plan detailing employee resourcing requirements of individual functions and the organization as a whole.

Name: Develop compensation strategy
Element Description: Designing a plan that specifies the combination of wages, salaries, and benefits the employees receive in exchange for work. Define the total amount of compensation, in addition to the manner in which the compensation is paid and the purposes for which employees can receive bonuses, salary increases, and incentives.

Name: Establish incentive strategy
Element Description: Creating a scheme of awards and recognition for sales employees to promote a results-based culture. Create specific incentives to reach desired outcomes, such as landing key clients, growing the customer base, providing exceptional servicing, and increasing profit margins.

Name: Develop succession plan
Element Description: Creating and implementing the plan for continuation of key positions within the organization. Identify internal people with the potential to fill key business leadership positions. Provide critical development experiences to employees who can move into important roles. Engage leaders to support the development of high-potential leaders.

Name: Develop high performers/leadership programs
Element Description: Creating a program that incorporates incentives and compensation put forth by the organization to recognize high performing workers and excellence in leadership.

Name: Develop diversity, equity, and inclusion plan
Element Description: Creating and implementing the plan for ensuring a diverse work force. Develop and hire employees with varying characteristics including, but not limited to, religious and political beliefs, gender, ethnicity, education, socioeconomic background, sexual orientation, and geographic location.

Name: Implement diversity, equity, and inclusion plan
Element Description: Execution of diversity, equity, and inclusion plans within an organization.  Often called a DEI plan.

Name: Design talent development program
Element Description: Identifying skills, knowledge, and attributes that need enhancement in order to perform a job. Develop the appropriate training programs. These programs can be computer-based, classroom, or on-the-job training, etc.

Name: Design talent acquisition program
Element Description: Developing a program to entice prospective resources to engage with the organization for a position of employment.

Name: Develop other HR programs
Element Description: Creating HR programs and services such as employee engagements programs to promote positive employee behavior. Create a variety of programs and services to support employees' professional and personal needs at work and at home.

Name: Develop HR policies
Element Description: Creating rules and regulations that govern the HR function. Develop a policy plan that serves as a guideline for setting rules and regulations that help in achieving the HR goals and objectives.

Name: Administer HR policies
Element Description: Ensuring rules and regulations are followed and are flexible enough to accommodate indispensable deviations.

Name: Plan employee benefits
Element Description: Planning benefits in kind (also called fringe benefits, perquisites, or perks). Include various types of non-wage compensations provided to employees in addition to normal wages or salaries.

Name: Develop workforce strategy models
Element Description: Creating and implementing models for effectively strategizing the work force of the organization. Develop a model that specifies the organization's overall approach for maximizing the performance of its work force by defining the goals, objectives, and expectations of the work force. Manage all aspects of performance required for the work force to function, including recruitment, selection, retention, and professional development.

Name: Implement workforce strategy models
Element Description: Implementing models for effectively strategizing the work force of the organization. Carry out all aspects of performance required for the work force to function, including recruitment, selection, retention, and professional development.

Name: Monitor and update strategy, plans, and policies
Element Description: Supervising the HR strategy, plans, and policies in order to refurbish them whenever needed. Determine the performance of HR plans and policies by measuring the objective achievement rate and its contribution to the overall business strategy. Ensure that information about these plans and strategies is effectively communicated to various stakeholders. Incorporate any suggestions by these stakeholders when revising HR plans and policies.

Name: Measure realization of objectives
Element Description: Determining the accomplishment of HR goals and objectives. Evaluate the effectiveness of the HR function by estimating the present rate of achievement of the established objectives. Use metrics to determine if the objectives are being realized. Leverage measures such as turnover, training, return on human capital, costs of labor, and expenses per employee.

Name: Measure contribution to business strategy
Element Description: Determining the role of HR function in implementing the organizational strategy. Measure the correlation between the HR performance and the overall business strategy. Calculate the amount of contribution of the HR function to the overall business growth.

Name: Communicate plans and provide updates to stakeholders
Element Description: Conveying the plans for HR function to stakeholders. Ensure that the HR plans and strategy are effectively communicated to the people who can affect or be affected by the organization's actions, objectives, and policies such as the creditors, shareholders, employees, and suppliers. Provide regular updates to these stakeholders to ensure effective communication.

Name: Review and revise HR plans
Element Description: Reassessing the strategies, plans, and policies of the HR function, with the objective of revising them. Revisit the schematic plans for the HR function. Taking stock of any suggestions or feedback from the stakeholders, revamp the blueprint of HR strategies and plans.

Name: Develop competency management models
Element Description: Creating and implementing the tools for managing the competency levels of HR. Design a model for integrating HR planning with business planning. Assess current HR capacity based on the competencies against the capacity needed to achieve the vision, mission, and business goals of the organization. Consider factors such as employee development, career path, compensation policies, and performance management.

Name: Recruit, source, and select employees
Element Description: Determining and handling employee requirements. Recruit or source the candidates as per the requirements. Screen and select the most appropriate candidates. Take care of the newly hired and re-hired employees. Maintain records of information for all applicants.

Name: Manage employee requisitions
Element Description: Handling the requirements for new employees. Create and open job requisitions by clearly defining the job descriptions. Post these requirements internally and externally, and modify them as appropriate. Manage the dates of the whole requisition process.

Name: Align staffing plan to work force plan and business unit strategies/resource needs
Element Description: Creating a correspondence between the plan for hiring new employees and the desired employee requirements. Staff an adequate amount of people with the appropriate skills to effectively accomplish its legislative, regulatory, service, and production requirements.

Name: Develop and maintain job descriptions
Element Description: Creating descriptions for job requisitions. Define the normal components of a job description, such as the overall position description with general areas of responsibility listed, essential functions of the job described with a couple of examples of each, required knowledge, skills, abilities, required education and experience, a description of the physical demands, and a description of the work environment.

Name: Open job requisitions
Element Description: Developing specific job requisitions, and ensuring their accessibility. Create and open a job requisition to fill the vacant positions within the organization. Clearly describe the job title, department, fill date, and the requisite skills and qualifications for the job.

Name: Post job requisitions
Element Description: Posting and advertising job descriptions. Display open job descriptions internally and externally. Use public portals, online portals, and websites to upload these requisitions in order for applications to be received.

Name: Modify job requisitions
Element Description: Making the necessary alterations to job requisitions. Revamp or revise the job requisitions in case a position is filled or is not vacant anymore, as well as in case of any new openings. (It involves Manage the internal/external job posting websites [10449] to make the necessary changes.)

Name: Notify hiring manager
Element Description: Informing and communicating with the hiring manager. Notify the manager responsible for the hiring process in cases of any new position openings or changes.

Name: Manage requisition dates
Element Description: Determining and managing the dates for the employee requisition process.

Name: Recruit/Source candidates
Element Description: Recruiting new candidates for deployment across various functional areas inside the organization. Select methods for sourcing new employees. Manage relationships with third-party agencies. Stage recruitment fairs and drives. Manage employee referral programs.

Name: Determine recruitment methods and channels
Element Description: Defining the methods and channels for recruitments in order to maximize the amount of candidate availability. Use channels such as headhunting, job postings, job portals, networking websites, and media advertising. Choose from the various methods of recruitment such as internal/external third-party sourcing.

Name: Perform recruiting activities/events
Element Description: Organizing and executing recruiting activities and events. Activities and events include on-campus hiring, refresher courses, information sessions, career fairs, etc. to increase the coverage of the sourcing in order to ensure that the most deserving and appropriate candidates are hired.

Name: Manage recruitment vendors
Element Description: Establishing and maintaining relationships with recruitment vendors (suppliers). Create and maintain relationships with third-party agencies such as staffing and firms to expand. Use these relationships to implement the sourcing process effectively.

Name: Manage employee referral programs
Element Description: Creating and managing a recruiting strategy where current employees are rewarded for referring qualified candidates for employment.

Name: Manage recruitment channels
Element Description: Establishing and maintaining channels for recruiting. Extract the best out of every recruitment channel. Manage all the processes related to all the sourcing channels.

Name: Screen and select candidates
Element Description: Evaluating and selecting potential employees through interviews, tests, etc.

Name: Identify and deploy candidate selection tools
Element Description: Identifying and implementing tools for the selection of candidates. Recognize candidate selection tools such as screening, telephone interviews, hiring manager interviews, drug testing, and skills assessment. Effectively deploy these tools to check if the candidates fit in the workplace or not, as well as to ensure workplace safety.

Name: Interview candidates
Element Description: Assessing the candidates by their performance in the interviews. Conduct HR interview, technical interview, hiring manager interview, etc. Understand the mindset of the candidate, and comprehend his/her personal and professional lives.

Name: Test candidates
Element Description: Examining the candidates through tests. Prepare tools such as aptitude, technical, and grammar tests. Test the skills of the candidate through a written, oral, or computerized test.

Name: Select and reject candidates
Element Description: Approving the deserving candidates, and rejecting the others. Examining the performance of candidates. Ensure candidates would fit well with the organization. (Assess performance from Interview candidates [10457] and Test candidates [10458].)

Name: Manage new hire/re-hire
Element Description: Creating and making job offers to the selected candidates. Fairly negotiate the job offers. Agree on terms with the candidate to complete the hiring process.

Name: Draw up and make offer
Element Description: Compiling job-related information for the selected candidates in order to make up a job. Include information about the job description, reporting relationship, salary, bonus potential, benefits, and vacation allotment.

Name: Negotiate offer
Element Description: Negotiating an offer with selected candidates. Discuss the job offer with the candidate to ensure a mutual understanding.

Name: Hire candidate
Element Description: Wrapping up the process for hiring candidates. Agree to all hiring terms and conditions. Have the candidate accept and sign the job offer.

Name: Manage applicant information
Element Description: Creating and maintaining a system for managing the information of applicants. Create records for all candidates who apply. Maintain and track information through the use applicant-tracking systems.

Name: Obtain candidate background information
Element Description: Conducting a background investigation on the candidates with the objective of looking up and compiling criminal, commercial, and financial records.

Name: Create applicant record
Element Description: Creating and documenting the records of all applicants. Manage all individual applicants, including hires and non-hires. Maintain records to avoid any duplication and promote efficiency.

Name: Manage/track applicant data
Element Description: Keeping track of all the information about the candidates who apply for jobs. Use applicant-tracking systems that can be accessed online as a central location and database for recruitment efforts.

Name: Complete position classification and level of experience
Element Description: Identifying the requirements for the position to be filled. Determine the experience and skills necessary to perform the tasks outlined.

Name: Archive and retain records of non-hires
Element Description: Retaining and storing the records of the candidates who were rejected and not hired to ensure future availability in case the need arises. Create a centralized repository of profiles. Label these records in order to readily identify them. Add remarks for any future consideration.

Name: Manage employee onboarding, training, and development
Element Description: Assisting employees in developing their capabilities, and providing them counseling services. Handle the orientation and deployment of the employees. Administer the performance of employees. Administer the development and enhancement of the employees. Provide training and development programs for employees.

Name: Manage employee orientation and deployment
Element Description: Creating and maintaining various employee on-boarding programs typically known as induction programs in order to ensure that the new employees are effectively introduced to the organization and its existing employees. Examine and evaluate the performance of these induction programs. Execute these programs on the ground level.

Name: Create/maintain employee onboarding program
Element Description: Creating and maintaining a mechanism through which new employees acquire the necessary knowledge, skills, and behaviors to become effective organizational members and insiders. Conduct formal meetings, lectures, videos, printed materials, and/or computer-based orientations to introduce newcomers to their new jobs and the organization.

Name: Develop employee induction program
Element Description: Designing a program to systematically introduce newly hired employees to the organizational culture of the company.

Name: Maintain/Update employee induction program
Element Description: Managing the orientation and training of new employees about the organizational culture of the company.

Name: Evaluate the effectiveness of the employee onboarding program
Element Description: Assessing the performance and effectiveness of employee on-boarding program. Examine the performance of on-boarding program through feedback and reviews from the new employees. Create web and written forms. Obtain information through face-to-face discussions.

Name: Execute onboarding program
Element Description: Bringing the employee on-boarding program into effect. Implement Create/Maintain employee on-boarding program [10474]. Conduct training sessions and employee engagement programs.

Name: Manage employee performance
Element Description: Defining individual performance objectives. Review performance in order to provide appraisals. Evaluate the efficiency and effectiveness of the current performance program. Update it regularly.

Name: Define employee performance objectives
Element Description: Outlining the objectives for employee performance. Establish key performance objectives and measures such as customer-focus objectives, financially focused objectives, and employee growth objectives.

Name: Review employee performance
Element Description: Execution of employee reviews/performance on a frequent basis.

Name: Manage employee performance
Element Description: Management of reviewing employee performance.  This includes the tools that are used, the frequency of the reviews, and how the reviews are used within the organization.

Name: Evaluate and review performance program
Element Description: Assessing and revamping performance programs, including the instruments used to measure employee performance standards. Review and upgrade these performance programs to avoid any deprivations and ensure effectiveness.

Name: Manage employee career development
Element Description: Establishing employee development guidelines. Lay out career paths and plans for them. Manage the development of their skills to enhance their skills, ability, and knowledge.

Name: Define employee development guidelines
Element Description: Outlining the guidelines for development of employees. Design development policies and procedures to identify areas of growth for employees, either in their current position or in preparation for future roles. Include topics related to knowledge and skill development.

Name: Develop employee career plans and career paths
Element Description: Designing a future career path for the employees that encourages them to explore and gather information.

Name: Manage employee skill and competency development
Element Description: Administering the development of employee skills. Conduct training, coaching and mentoring, job-rotation and cross training, lateral moves, etc.

Name: Develop and train employees
Element Description: Creating a link between employee and organizational development needs. Conduct and manage employee training programs by considering the need and availability of these programs.

Name: Align employee with organization development needs
Element Description: Aligning the needs of the employees to development needs.

Name: Define employee competencies and skills
Element Description: Defining the skills, knowledge, abilities, and attributes needed to carry out a specific job.

Name: Align learning programs with competencies and skills
Element Description: Aligning the learning programs with the core capabilities and competencies of the organization. Contextualize the training programs so that employees can expand their knowledge base and add new skills in line with the core competencies of the organization.

Name: Establish training needs by analysis of required and available skills
Element Description: Determining the training necessitated by business processes, using an examination of skill sets that are needed by the organization and those already possessed. Examine the various skills required by individual employees. Design training in light of the availability of resources to provide specific segments of training.

Name: Develop, conduct, and manage employee and/or management training programs
Element Description: Creating, implementing, and managing the programs for training employees. Create and design sessions on the basis of the needs and the availability of the skills. Conduct the sessions on the ground. Manage all aspects related to the training programs. Consider including literacy training, interpersonal skills training, technical training, problem-solving training, diversity or sensitivity training, etc.

Name: Manage examinations and certifications
Element Description: Managing identified training programs for employees. Engage with industries to provide certifications, administer certification test, and maintain active certification.

Name: Liaise with external certification authorities
Element Description: Coordinating with third party certification authorities to provide training and certifications for necessary skills.

Name: Administer certification tests
Element Description: Providing tests to the workforce that will satisfy completion of certifications.

Name: Appraise experience qualifications
Element Description: Ascertaining the experience level needed to qualify for a specific job or certification within the organization. Some certificates require practical experience as well as training programs.

Name: Administer certificate issue and maintenance
Element Description: Administering certificates to all candidates that have successfully met experience qualifications, and passed all tests necessary to obtain the certificate.

Name: Monitor and evaluate learning programs
Element Description: Oversight of the organization's learning programs.  This process also includes the effectiveness of these programs.

Name: Manage employee relations
Element Description: Assisting general management in developing, maintaining, and improving employee relationships. This is accomplished through communication, performance management, processing grievances, and/or dispute. Interpret and convey organizational policies.

Name: Manage labor relations
Element Description: Managing labor relations, the collective bargaining process, and the relationships between the labor and management. Take care of employee grievances.

Name: Manage collective bargaining process
Element Description: Managing any negotiations between an employer and a group of employees that determine the conditions of employment. Engage employees to reach agreements in regulating working conditions.

Name: Manage labor management partnerships
Element Description: Handling partnerships between labor and management. Develop a lasting two-way relationship that is beneficial for the labor, management, and the organization.

Name: Manage employee grievances
Element Description: Taking care or resolving any complaint raised by an employee by procedures provided for in a collective agreement, an employment contract, or by other mechanisms established by an employer.

Name: Monitor legal and regulatory environment
Change details: RENAME, WAS:Understand legal and regulatory environment
Element Description: Awareness of the employee legislature that is in place for the organization.  The regulatory environment could include areas, regions, or countries.

Name: Reward and retain employees
Element Description: Creating frameworks for rewarding and recognizing employees with the objective of retaining them. Create and manage programs for provision of rewards, recognition, and motivation. Manage and administer the benefits for employees. Help assist and retain employees. Administer payroll to employees.

Name: Develop and manage reward, recognition, and motivation programs
Element Description: Developing a salary/compensation structure and plan; developing a benefits and reward plan; develop commission plan; performing competitive analyses of benefits and rewards; identifying compensation requirements based on compensation, benefits, and HR policies; administering compensation, commission, and rewards to employees; and rewarding and motivating employees.

Name: Develop salary/compensation structure and plan
Element Description: Creating the framework for the provision of salary/compensation to employees. Break down the salary structure into different components such as fixed pay, variable pay, bonus, and allowances such medical allowance, and rent allowance, etc. Develop, adjust, and maintain a pay structure.

Name: Develop benefits and rewards plan
Element Description: Developing a plan for provision of rewards, commission, and benefits to employees. Plan health benefits, retirement benefits, non-monetary benefits, etc.

Name: Perform competitive analysis of benefits and rewards
Element Description: Analyzing and evaluating the organization's benefits and rewards plan. Compare/Benchmark the benefits and employees plan with other organizations to adhere to industry standard practices.

Name: Identify compensation requirements based on financial, benefits, and HR policies
Element Description: Recognizing the employee requirements for compensation on the basis of the financial, benefits, and HR policies of the organization. Recognize individual compensation requirements regarding the financial policies of the organization. Consider the benefits plan and overall HR policies while selecting compensation requirements.

Name: Administer compensation and rewards to employees
Element Description: Managing the provision of compensations and rewards to the employees while maintaining consistency with the compensation and benefits plan. Follow the compensation and benefits plan rigorously in order to avoid any discrepancies.

Name: Reward and motivate employees
Element Description: Rewarding and stimulating the performance efforts of employees. Create methods for motivating employees. Spur extrinsic and intrinsic motivation.

Name: Review retention and motivation indicators
Element Description: Reassessing the indicators for retention and motivation of employees. Monitor the indicators that signal the levels of motivation and retention. Regularly update and upgrade indicators to avoid depreciation and ensure high efficiency.

Name: Review compensation plan
Element Description: Analyzing existing compensation plans and making changes necessary to continue to retain employees.

Name: Manage and administer benefits
Element Description: Managing and ensuring benefits enrollment by the employees. Process any benefit claims made by the employees. Balance the estimated amount and entitled amount of benefits.

Name: Deliver employee benefits program
Element Description: Implementing the programs that specify employee benefits, other than salary provided, such as those concerning medical care, death, and disability.

Name: Administer benefit enrollment
Element Description: Handling the employee enrollment for obtaining benefits. Manage employee enrollment and eligibility. Encourage employees to enroll for benefits.

Name: Process claims
Element Description: Processing any formal requests or demands made by the employees claiming that they have earned some benefits. Send the request further up the managerial hierarchy to ensure approval.

Name: Perform benefit reconciliation
Element Description: Carrying out reconciliation of benefits delivered to employees. Compare the estimated benefit requirement made by the employee and the actual amount of benefits the employee is entitled to receive.

Name: Manage employee assistance and retention
Element Description: Managing activities centered around delivering programs to support work/life balance for employees; developing family support systems; reviewing retention and motivation indicators; and reviewing compensation plans.

Name: Deliver programs to support work/life balance for employees
Element Description: Designing programs that prompt proper balance between work (i.e., career and ambition) and lifestyle (i.e., health, pleasure, leisure, family, and spiritual development/meditation). Account for dependent care, flexible working arrangements, leaves of absence, on-the-job training, etc.

Name: Manage flexible working
Element Description: Creation and execution of a plan that might allow for work from home days, or alternate hours.

Name: Develop family support systems
Element Description: Creating a support structure that aligns with local and federal laws that allow for support for families. This could include things like maternity leave, care for a family member, or in some cases, extended sick leave.

Name: Administer payroll
Element Description: Managing the sum of all financial records of salaries for an employee, including wages, bonuses, and deductions. Use a payroll management system to deal with the financial aspects of employees' salaries, allowances, deductions, gross pay, net pay, etc. Generate pay slips for a specific period.

Name: Redeploy and retire employees
Element Description: Managing the reassignment and retirement of employees. Manage the process of employee promotion and demotion. Administer separation, retirement, and leaves of absence. Outplace employees. Deploy personnel. Relocate employees in order to manage assignments.

Name: Manage promotion and demotion process
Element Description: Administering the process of promoting and demoting employees. Design a system for advancing or demoting an employee's rank or position. Leverage techniques such as horizontal promotion, vertical promotion, dry promotion, and involuntary/voluntary demotion.

Name: Manage separation
Element Description: Managing the process of employee separation, including resignations, discharges, and layoffs. Inform the employee of the termination. Complete paperwork for continuation of benefits.

Name: Manage retirement
Element Description: Managing and administering instances where a person stops employment completely.

Name: Manage leave of absence
Element Description: Managing the period of time that an employee must be away from their primary job, while maintaining the status of employee (i.e., paid and unpaid leave of absence but not vacations, holidays, hiatuses, sabbaticals, and work-from-home programs).

Name: Develop and implement employee outplacement
Element Description: Helping former employees transition to new jobs or to re-orient themselves in the job market. Deliver help through one-on-one sessions or in a group format. Provide guidance in career evaluation, resume writing, interview preparation, developing networks, and job searching.

Name: Manage workforce scheduling
Element Description: Organizing the workforce so that all positions are covered for all shifts with the necessary skilled resources in place. Have a system in place to backfill positions while an employee is on leave.

Name: Receive required resources/skills and capabilities
Element Description: Obtaining resources necessary to fill a position utilizing specific skills and capabilities.

Name: Manage resource deployment
Element Description: Allocating employees. Deploy personnel to ensure that the labor of the organization is continuously in an optimal relation to the jobs and organizational structure.

Name: Relocate employees and manage assignments
Element Description: Managing the relocation of employees in order to carry out assignments. Manage internal business processes to transfer employees, their families, and/or entire departments of a business to a new location.

Name: Manage expatriates
Element Description: Managing foreign resources. Manage employees who are sent to live abroad for a defined time period, as well as non-native employees.

Name: Manage employee information and analytics
Element Description: Managing the employee reporting processes, employee inquiry process, employee information and data, and the HR information systems. Create and administer the employee metrics. Develop and handle the time and attendance systems. Refurbish the indicators for employee retention and motivation.

Name: Manage reporting processes
Element Description: Providing information and reports regarding employees to management.

Name: Manage employee inquiry process
Element Description: Handling instances where an employee believes that he/she has been inappropriately treated or he/she desires clarification. Encourage employees to inquire when needed. Record and clarify the issues for which the enquiry has been made.

Name: Manage and maintain employee data
Element Description: Capturing and updating employee information and data and information on the employees.

Name: Manage human resource information systems HRIS
Element Description: Administering and maintaining HR information systems that take care of activities related to HR, accounting, management, and payroll.

Name: Develop and manage employee measures
Element Description: Creating and maintaining performance metrics for employees. Create and manage a strategic system of data and statistics to accurately gauge each employee's information. Consider productivity metrics, efficiency metrics, training metrics, etc.

Name: Develop and manage time and attendance systems
Element Description: Developing and maintaining systems for managing the time and attendance of employees. Routinely upgrade the process and systems that track when employees start and stop work, the department where the work is performed, attendance in addition to tracking meals and breaks, the type of work performed, and the number of items produced.

Name: Develop workforce analytics
Element Description: Understand, develop, and gather workforce data in support of stakeholder requirements.

Name: Determine stakeholder requirements
Element Description: Collect and manage requirements from various enterprise stakeholders about workforce analytics.

Name: Identify research questions
Element Description: Summarize stakeholder requirements into discrete research questions in support of workforce analytics.

Name: Select workforce analysis methodology
Element Description: Consider stakeholder requirements, research questions, and organizations standards around research to select appropriate research methodology in support of workforce analytics.

Name: Identify workforce data sources
Element Description: Identify appropriate data sources for workforce analytics data while considering organizational standards for data sources.

Name: Gather workforce data
Element Description: Collect and procure, as needed, workforce data from internal and external data sources in support of workforce analytics.

Name: Implement workforce analytics
Element Description: Transform, develop, and communicate workforce data into analytics in support of organizational requirements.

Name: Transform workforce analysis data
Element Description: Logically and statistically validate collected or purchased data in support of analytics needs

Name: Develop insights into workforce analytics outcomes
Element Description: Synthesize insights from workforce analytics data

Name: Communicate workforce analysis outcomes
Element Description: Summarize, package, and distribute results of workforce analysis.

Name: Manage/Collect employee suggestions and perform employee research
Element Description: Procuring and handling suggestions from employees, and performing research on employees. Manage and analyze the programs that help the organization to tap into employee ideas for improving the organization's processes and/or products. Use surveys, focus groups, and other data-gathering methods to find out the attitudes, opinions, and feelings of members of an organization.

Name: Manage employee communication
Element Description: Creating an effective plan that initiates and promotes communication and engagement among the employees and between employees and management.

Name: Develop employee communication plan
Element Description: Creating a plan for managing communication among employees. Inform employees of direction. Counter resistance with change management approaches. Seek specific areas of input to the decision-making process. Seek varying degrees of involvement and co-creation.

Name: Conduct employee engagement surveys
Element Description: Questioning employees to ascertain overall workplace satisfaction.

Name: Deliver employee communications
Element Description: Implementing the communication plan for employees. Initiate dialogues and engagement by monitoring the exchange of ideas and opinions, the development of personal relationships, etc.

Name: Manage Information Technology (IT)
Element Description: Managing process groups relevant to the business of information technology within an organization. The process groups include "Develop and manage IT customer relationships", "Develop and manage IT business strategy", " Develop and manage IT resilience and risk", " Manage information", " Develop and manage services/solutions", "Deploy services/solutions", and " Create and manage support services/solutions".

Name: Develop and manage IT customer relationships
Element Description: Creating and administering relationships with IT customers. Understanding customer needs including high-level business requirements for IT transformation. Plan for and communicate IT services along with establishing IT service levels, providing transformation guidance, and performance analysis that foster IT customer relationships.

Name: Understand IT customer needs
Element Description: Assessing the customer communities along with current IT operational capabilities and usage.

Name: Understand IT customer communities
Element Description: Interacting with IT customers to understand the IT needs through a collaborative community through involvement, connection, and informed communication.

Name: Assess IT customer operational capabilities
Element Description: Evaluate the ability of the group of staff dependent on information technology, to align resources and critical processes according to organizational vision being able to deliver effectively and efficiently.

Name: Identify IT customer transformation needs
Element Description: Identifying changing needs of staff dependent on information technology based on continuous improvement to deliver results according to organizational goals.

Name: Understand business requirements for IT capabilities
Element Description: Understanding business requirements for the existing IT environment as well as future IT needs.

Name: Understand IT landscape
Element Description: Understanding the complete logical structure and working of the organization's IT landscape. Assess the configuration of hardware and software (IT Assets) across the organization that supports overall business operations.

Name: Develop IT visioning
Element Description: Developing goals to define IT vision. Define and document ideas, direction, and activities which enable information technology to reach these goals.

Name: Outline IT service expectations
Element Description: Defining a roadmap to meet organizational expectations from information technology services while considering how it will affect the business.

Name: Plan and communicate IT services
Element Description: Create and design an organized and curated collection of all IT-related services that can be performed by, for, or within the organization. Maintain and convey information about deliverables, prices, contact points, and processes for requesting an information technology service.

Name: Manage IT customer expectations
Element Description: Managing customer expectations of the existing IT environment while considering how it will affect the business.

Name: Define future IT services
Element Description: Defining the expected demand and usage of information technology services to meet organization's future business goals. Gather necessary information about the processes, resource requirements, and structures pertaining to planned business growth.

Name: Determine IT performance indicators
Element Description: Determining IT KPIs crucial to the organization's success. Measure indicators such as IT costs as percentage of revenue, IT maintenance ratio, and system downtime in an effort to evaluate the performance of IT across the organization.

Name: Create IT marketing messages
Element Description: Developing concise statements that position the value proposition around the pressing concerns of the internal IT user base, thereby showing how the IT offerings are the right fit for a segment of IT customers.

Name: Create IT service marketing plan
Element Description: Creating a marketing strategy for IT offerings to customers. Plan processes for making budgets; identifying and developing media; and managing marketing content and promotional activities.

Name: Provide IT transformation guidance
Element Description: Understanding the necessity of IT transformation for the business. Collect and analyze customer requirements. Identify opportunities and prioritize outcomes. Develop and support business case for transformation. Develop transformation plan and roadmap.

Name: Develop IT transformation plans
Element Description: Developing a robust plan to replace or upgrade an organization's information technology systems. Understanding the business need of IT transformation from current to an expected state for the business. Developing a strategic plan for IT operating model, governance, service delivery, and workforce transformation.

Name: Collect IT customer requirements
Element Description: Identifying existing or potential IT gaps between the expected business performance levels and current business outcomes.

Name: Analyze IT customer requirements
Element Description: Assessing identified IT gaps to plan for remediation efforts to allow outcomes to meet established performance levels.

Name: Identify and prioritize IT opportunities
Element Description: Identifying IT opportunities on the basis of collection and analysis of IT customer requirements, then prioritize the identified IT opportunities on the basis of their importance.

Name: Facilitate solution design activities
Element Description: Providing a plan of action to provide solution to IT customers. The solution design should be based on the collection and analysis of IT customer requirements.

Name: Prioritize IT outcomes
Element Description: Prioritizing IT outcomes based on need, effectiveness, and efficiency.

Name: Develop business cases
Element Description: Create a business case with value proposition indicating current situation, proposed solution, financial analysis, and measurable benefits to the IT customers.

Name: Support business case
Element Description: Supporting business case with supporting research, business analysis, and background information on IT transformation.

Name: Develop transformation roadmap
Element Description: Creating a blueprint for execution of IT transformation from the existing state to the planned organizational structure based on the value proposition and projected business growth.

Name: Develop and manage IT service levels
Element Description: Establishing and maintaining service levels for the provision of IT services and solutions. Design and maintain the IT services and solution catalogue, as well as service level agreements. Evaluate the performance of IT service level agreements. Communicate the results to the management.

Name: Understand IT service requirements
Element Description: Understand requirements related to information technology services considering enterprise-level effects and understand potential achievements in the business environment.

Name: Forecast IT service demand
Element Description: Forecasting demand for IT services using current business growth, research, and customer feedback. Refine these forecasts, inspect the approach used in creating forecasts, and determine its accuracy.

Name: Maintain IT services catalog
Element Description: Maintain information about IT deliverables, prices, contact points, and processes for requesting a service.

Name: Define service level agreement
Element Description: Designing and maintaining commitment of service by performance evaluation of IT services and communicate the results to the management.

Name: Maintain IT customer contracts
Element Description: Maintaining and documenting commitment of service to staff for information technology contracts including providing software or hardware solution through communication channels like phone, email, and on-site services.

Name: Negotiate and establish service level agreements
Element Description: Establish a service level agreement, which is a negotiated agreement designed to create a common understanding about services, priorities, and responsibilities.

Name: Develop and maintain improvement processes
Element Description: Conveying the improvement opportunities for the business and level of IT services. Leverage the results obtained from the performance metrics of the business and IT service levels to identify and recognize any opportunities that would improve or enhance the efficiency of the business and IT service-level structure. Communicate these opportunities to management in order for the improvements to take effect.

Name: Manage IT customer relationships
Element Description: Managing the IT relationship with its customers by systematically coordinating interactions over multiple touch points on a regular basis. Coordinate the IT's efforts to reach out to its customers, which include emails, social-media interactions, newsletters, and direct conversations.

Name: Establish relationship management mechanisms
Element Description: Create mechanisms for effective public relationship in order to preserve the image and goodwill of the organization through the process.

Name: Understand IT customer strategy
Element Description: Understanding the strategy for staff dependent on information technology. Create a plan to create services and solutions, conduct daily operations, and train new employees.

Name: Understand IT customer environment
Element Description: Understanding the environment of staff dependent on information technology. Assess and evaluate services and solutions used by customers to conduct daily operations, and train new employees.

Name: Communicate IT capabilities
Element Description: Conveying the goals and objectives of the IT function and how it contributes to the overall business objectives to staff and departments across the organization.

Name: Manage IT requirements
Element Description: Managing the IT requirements for business objectives. Identify the requirements of hardware and software equipment to store, retrieve, transmit, and manipulate data related to business operations. Consider factors such as functional, design, growth phases, and delivery schedule while managing IT requirements.

Name: Analyze service performance
Element Description: Proactively manage IT service levels against IT customer requirements.

Name: Assess SLA compliance
Element Description: Gather data from each service target defined in an SLA for a time segment or review period to evaluate an overall performance percentage.

Name: Triage SLA compliance issues
Element Description: Prioritizing SLA compliance issues and plan for remediation.

Name: Collect feedback about IT products and services
Element Description: Collecting customer feedback about IT products and services effectiveness based on overall satisfaction. The data is collected through surveys, customer responses, and feedbacks based on the delivered products/services.

Name: Synthesize and distribute IT performance information
Element Description: Providing stakeholders with collected IT performance measures for further development based on evaluation.

Name: Develop and manage IT business strategy
Element Description: Handling the business of IT. Create a organization-wide strategy for the IT function. Define the organization's IT architecture. Manage the IT portfolio. Research and innovate in the field of IT. Assess and convey the performance and the value of the IT function.

Name: Define business technology and governance strategy
Element Description: Defining the need of technology in business and systematic implementation of IT investments. It comprises of assessing competitive technology components to ensure structural analysis, development, usage and security of technology for efficient business operations.

Name: Build and maintain IT strategic intelligence
Element Description: Building and maintaining intelligence towards changing organizational goals, supporting management, and operational or functional levels of the business. It is the ability to understand business trends that present threats or opportunities for IT in an organization.

Name: Monitor and map current and emerging technologies
Element Description: Monitoring and evaluating existing and forthcoming technologies to meet the current and future growth plans for business operations.

Name: Define and communicate digital transformation strategy
Element Description: Defining the integration of digital technology into business operations and service delivery, and convey the strategy to different segments of business. It is always backed by continuous improvement followed by periodic review and change per requirement of the business.

Name: Develop IT strategic alignment
Element Description: Developing the process of aligning the organization's business divisions and staff members with the organization's planned objectives for IT.

Name: Articulate IT alignment principles
Element Description: Systematic approach to clearly communicate and operate the usage of information technology as it relates to business objectives.

Name: Maintain IT strategic alignment
Element Description: Maintaining alignment of the organization's business divisions and staff members with the organization's planned objectives for IT.

Name: Manage IT portfolio strategy
Element Description: Strategy for systematic management of IT investments, projects, and activities. Analyze and examine the value of the IT portfolio and allocate resources based on business objectives.

Name: Establish and validate IT value criteria
Element Description: Create and certify the standards to determine the value of the investments, projects, and activities of IT function for the overall business objectives.

Name: Determine IT portfolio investment balance
Element Description: Determining the uninvested amount out of the total approved amount for overall IT management, IT investments, projects, and activities.

Name: Evaluate proposed IT investment projects
Change details: RENAME, WAS:Evaluate  proposed IT investment projects
Element Description: Evaluating IT investment projects to achieve overall business objectives in regard to implementation, efficiency, and profitability.

Name: Prioritize IT projects
Element Description: Listing the IT projects in the order of most important to the least. Determining which of many IT projects are most important or critical to business operations.

Name: Align IT resources to strategic priorities
Element Description: Aligning physical IT resources like software, IT infrastructure, networks, and non-physical resources like technology expertise, to strategic objectives ranked by their importance in achieving the strategic goals.

Name: Align IT portfolio to business objectives
Element Description: Aligning IT investments, projects, and activities to achieve overall business objectives.

Name: Define and maintain enterprise architecture
Element Description: Outlining and maintaining the organization's IT architecture. Establish the IT architecture definition and framework. Ensure the relevance of IT. Create and confirm the approach for IT maintenance. Create rules and regulations to guide IT architecture. Authenticate and finalize all IT related research and innovation that takes place within the organization.

Name: Create and publish enterprise architecture principles
Element Description: Creating and publishing high level statements of the fundamental values (principles) based on the organization's objectives that guide Information Technology decision-making and activities, and are the foundation for enterprise architecture.

Name: Establish and operate enterprise architecture governance
Element Description: Establishing and operating a structure by which an enterprise defines appropriate strategies and ensures development alignment with those strategies. Create and establish the rules, regulations, policies, and standards that will govern the individual components of the IT architecture, as well as the architecture in its entirety.

Name: Research technologies to innovate IT services and solutions
Element Description: Systematically investigating and studying materials and sources relevant to the IT function. Reach meaningful insights and conclusions in the form of new ideas and innovation for delivering IT services and solutions.

Name: Provide input to definition and prioritization of IT projects
Element Description: Analyze the value driven through IT projects and redefine and/or reprioritize. Evaluate planning, organizing, and implementation of IT projects based on research outcomes and business objectives.

Name: Define IT service management strategy
Element Description: Defining perspective, position, plans, and patterns needed to execute designing, delivering, managing, and improving the way information technology is used within an organization.

Name: Establish IT service management strategy and goals
Change details: RENAME, WAS:Establish  IT service management strategy and goals
Element Description: Implementing strategy for designing, delivering, managing, and improving the way information technology be used in the organization. The goal of IT Service Management is to ensure that the right processes, people, and technology are in place to meet business goals.

Name: Identify IT service operating and process requirements
Change details: RENAME, WAS:Identify  IT service operating and process requirements
Element Description: Identifying operating and process requirement for designing, delivering, managing, and improving the way information technology be used in the organization.

Name: Define IT service catalog
Element Description: Create and design an organized and curated collection of all IT-related services that can be performed by, for, or within the organization.

Name: Establish IT service management framework
Element Description: Create a layered structure for IT service management framework ensuring right processes, people, and technology are in place to meet business goals.

Name: Define and implement IT service management
Element Description: Defining and implementing activities involved in designing, creating, delivering, supporting, and managing the lifecycle of information technology services within an organization.

Name: Define and deploy support service management process tools and methods
Element Description: Establishing services for providing support to users of IT services and solutions. Define the plethora of services along with tools and methods by which the organization assists users of computers, software products, or other electronic/mechanical products.

Name: Monitor and report IT performance
Element Description: Supervising, analyzing, and reporting performance of information technology to ensure they are on-course and on-schedule in meeting the organizational objectives and performance targets.

Name: Control IT management system
Element Description: Regulating the IT management system through performance measures, governance, analysis, and monitoring through a variety of analytic tools. Evaluate IT finances, resource, services, projects, and value for report out.

Name: Determine IT performance measures
Element Description: Determining measures for evaluating the performance of IT services in the organization. Establish key performance indicators, including the IT services performance index.

Name: Define IT control points and assurance procedures governance model
Element Description: Establishing a governance model with its own structure and functions from where full or partial control can be exercised over the entire IT management system. Specify evaluation and quality control procedures in the structure.

Name: Monitor and analyze overall IT performance
Element Description: Monitoring and analyzing information technology performance measures to ensure timely completion, and that quality assurance is met at all steps of IT services.

Name: Monitor and analyze IT financial performance
Element Description: Checking and analyzing predetermined financial targets and timelines of IT management system. Monitoring their profitability, feasibility, and consistency. Study the revenues generated.

Name: Monitor and analyze IT value and benefits
Element Description: Examining and analyzing the value and benefits of IT service management to ensure benefits outweigh incurred costs.

Name: Optimize IT resource allocation
Element Description: Create process to assign and manage IT assets that support organization's strategic goals.

Name: Manage IT projects and services interdependencies
Element Description: Manage capabilities required for the successful delivery of information technology projects, which, by extension, affect the success of the overall IT services.

Name: Report IT service and project performance
Change details: RENAME, WAS:Report  IT service and project performance
Element Description: Process of collecting, analyzing, and reporting information regarding the performance of IT services and projects.

Name: Select, deploy, and operate IT performance analytics tools
Element Description: Select, establish, and operate analytics tool to analyze data and extract actionable and commercially relevant information on IT performance to evaluate or increase performance.

Name: Manage IT value portfolio
Element Description: Creating and establishing the value portfolio. Defining, analyzing, and examining the value of projects, investments, and activities of the IT function.

Name: Assess performance against IT service and project value criteria
Element Description: Process of evaluating performance to collect and analyze IT services and projects. Ensure expected IT service and project value based on established criteria.

Name: Quantify value of IT service and project portfolio investments
Element Description: Evaluate the value of the investments, projects, and activities of IT function by assigning it a quantifiable value with a profitable return to business operations.

Name: Communicate business technology value contribution
Element Description: Conveying the value addition through adopting technology targeting towards integrated profitable business operations.

Name: Determine and implement IT portfolio adjustments
Element Description: Determining and implementing IT investments, projects, and activities based on trending technological advancements in the existing environment in order to achieve overall business objectives.

Name: Define and manage technology innovation
Element Description: Outline and manage the innovation of technology within the organization. Research and understand emerging future technological concepts and capabilities. Plan for IT innovation investments. Plan and execute viable innovation projects.

Name: Establish selection criteria for research initiatives
Element Description: Establishing the standard for selecting IT research initiatives to align with organizational criteria for implementing future technologies.

Name: Analyze emerging technology concepts
Element Description: Assessing new and future technologies relevant to the organization's vision of its IT capabilities.

Name: Identify technology concepts and capabilities
Element Description: Identification of conceptual elements that define the benefits of technology to business.

Name: Execute IT research projects
Element Description: Implement information technology research projects that focus on meeting the goals of the organization's IT services and capabilities.

Name: Evaluate IT research project outcomes
Element Description: Assessing IT research projects based on defined outcome expectations.

Name: Identify and promote viable concepts
Element Description: Determine project viability. Promote relevant IT innovations that meet business objectives.

Name: Develop and plan IT investment projects
Change details: RENAME, WAS:Develop and plan  IT investment projects
Element Description: Develop and plan long-term allocation of funds for information technology endeavors to meet business goals.

Name: Develop and manage IT resilience and risk
Element Description: Develop and include the processes required to rapidly adapt and respond to any internal or external opportunity, demand, disruption, or threat to IT. Develop a more dynamic, strategic, and integrated approach to managing risk and compliance obligations.

Name: Develop IT compliance, risk, and security strategy
Element Description: Ensuring that the organization effectively manages risk. Develop rules and standards for robust IT operations, manage risk, and adopt measures to protect integrity, confidentiality, and security of IT assets.

Name: Determine and evaluate IT regulatory and audit requirements
Element Description: Determining and evaluating IT regulatory and audit requirements. Train employees on regulatory and audit requirements. Records for the appropriate regulatory and audit agencies must be maintained and the new product process must be approved by the appropriate regulatory body before it is published to the organization.

Name: Understand business unit risk tolerance
Element Description: Understand the risk tolerance levels of individual business units, given risk-return trade-offs for one or more anticipated and predictable consequences.

Name: Establish IT risk tolerance
Element Description: Determine the specific maximum risk to take in quantitative terms for each relevant risk sub-category, including strategic, operational, financial, and compliance risks.

Name: Establish risk ownership

Element Description: Conveying service support needs within the organization, with the objective of providing required support services. Define processes and procedures needed to support users of IT services and solutions. Convey these procedures to appropriate governing authority.

Name: Define IT escalation mechanisms
Element Description: Determining mechanisms to report for a higher degree of decision making depending on the criticality of IT escalations. Define the processes and procedures needed to follow for IT escalation at different levels. Convey the mechanisms within the organization.

Name: Manage IT service support resources
Element Description: Managing resources required for administration of IT service support. Establish sources that will make use of e-mail, live support software online, or a tool where users can log a call or incident in order to retrieve IT support.

Name: Coordinate with external support providers
Element Description: Developing a strategy that will make use of multiple resources to coordinate with external support providers in order to make the support services work more smoother.

Name: Triage IT service delivery incidents
Element Description: Sorting the incidents of IT service delivery in certain order so that the services could be delivered based on the criticality.

Name: Monitor IT service support performance
Element Description: Defining methodology and frequency of assessment for measuring and monitoring performance of various processes and activities of IT service support against standard set goals.

Name: Develop and manage service delivery operations
Element Description: Developing and managing different delivery services using service delivery systems for operational activities within the IT function in order to achieve organizations goal.

Name: Operate and monitor online systems
Element Description: Operating and defining methodology of assessment for measuring and monitoring performance of online systems against its expected result.

Name: Run and monitor batch job schedule
Element Description: Operate and monitor the application of scheduling batch jobs to be run in the background at a certain date and time.

Name: Manage service delivery workloads
Element Description: Analyze and manage workload needs in relation to service delivery. Plan resources and mechanism around those workload needs so that services could be delivered smoothly.

Name: Manage infrastructure performance and capacity
Element Description: Managing the performance and capacity of infrastructure by using key performance indicators to routinely track the performance and capacity levels. Review performance. Evaluate the efficiency and effectiveness of the infrastructure.

Name: Respond to unplanned operational issues
Element Description: Addressing to an issue in operational activities within the IT function, that occur outside of normal routine or preventative maintenance.

Name: Produce and distribute output media
Element Description: Identify and introduce resources to display output in a viewable form to key decision makers and evaluators.

Name: Monitor IT infrastructure security
Element Description: Identifying, examining, and recognizing any flaw or breach in security of IT infrastructure. Ensure that protocols and guidelines for individual IT components are being followed and there is no misuse of information and breach of individual or organizational privacy.

Name: Manage IT infrastructure/data recovery
Element Description: Managing resources of IT infrastructure and their recovery capacity. Manage storage, computer hardware, software, and infrastructure resources that can be stored as inventory or provided by the organization as needed. Managing backup/recovery for IT services and solutions. Use a backup system or application.

Name: Manage infrastructure resource administration
Element Description: Managing the resources required for administration of IT infrastructure. Manage the IT inventory and assets. Take care of the organization's IT resource capacity.

Name: Manage infrastructure configuration
Element Description: Identifying and tracking individual configuration items, documenting functional capabilities and interdependencies of IT infrastructure. Determining the gaps and needs in order to enhance existing infrastructure configuration.

Name: Perform infrastructure component maintenance
Element Description: Evaluating and maintaining all aspects of infrastructure component maintenance. Ensure that all components of an IT infrastructure are functioning properly as per the expectation. Maintenance includes all preventative, routine, and corrective measures.

Name: Install/configure/upgrade infrastructure components
Element Description: Installing/configuring/upgrading all the components required for operational activities within IT infrastructure. Ensure that all components of an IT infrastructure are functioning properly and updated to latest version/technology.

Name: Maintain IT asset records
Element Description: Maintaining the complete list of IT items or resources available with the organization with the details on date of purchase, licenses, deployment and SLAs.

Name: Administer IT licenses/user agreements
Element Description: Administering and overseeing the terms and policies associated with licensing the IT intellectual property. Create and manage the policies and terms governing the possible granting of a license to any external agent. Demarcate a clear framework that governs the licensing of any patents or copyrights held by the organization.

Name: Provide IT infrastructure service and capabilities
Element Description: Providing all the infrastructure services and capabilities required for operational activities within the IT function supporting overall business objectives.

Name: Operate IT user support
Element Description: Managing systematic user support functionality and capability through defined procedures. Determine, record, and monitor user requests. Execute issue/request resolution. Utilize escalation path when needed. Resolve issue/request.

Name: Triage IT issues/requests
Element Description: Evaluate and assign IT issues/requests accordingly to allow for the correct routing of IT issues to the relevant support teams.

Name: Provide IT resolution capabilities
Element Description: Providing the necessary skills and competencies required to efficiently provide IT resolution through the support structure.

Name: Manage IT user requests
Element Description: Creating an effective plan and structure to address and resolve requests of IT users. Determine, record, and monitor user requests. Obtain information about the effectiveness and performance of the user request handling process from the IT users through various means.

Name: Escalate IT requests
Element Description: Follow processes and procedures to escalate IT requests to required levels for resolution or effective decision making when necessary.

Name: Resolve IT issues/requests
Element Description: Creating a structure to resolve issues/requests of IT services using different mechanisms.

Name: Execute IT continuity and recovery action
Element Description: Successfully implement preventive measures to manage IT risk of exposure to internal and external threats. Integrating the disciplines of Emergency Response, Crisis Management, Disaster Recovery (technology continuity) and Business Continuity for IT.

Name: Manage Financial Resources
Element Description: Overseeing key back-office processes for organizations. This category includes process groups related to planning and management accounting, revenue accounting, general accounting and reporting, fixed-asset project accounting, payroll, accounts payable and expense reimbursements, treasury operations, internal controls, tax management, international funds/consolidation, and global trade services.

Name: Perform planning and management accounting
Element Description: Determining different stages of the planning process and accounting. Classify, determine, analyze, interpret, and communicate information to make up-to-date business decisions for better management and control functions.

Name: Perform planning/budgeting/forecasting
Element Description: Allocating funds to meet future and current financial goals. Led by the chief financial officer, have the finance function plan, budget, and forecast in order to determine and describe long and short-term financial goals.

Name: Develop and maintain budget policies and procedures
Element Description: Formulating financial budgetary guidelines and strategies. Develop a framework for rules and regulations regarding budgets. Create a step-by-step process to achieve financial goals.

Name: Prepare periodic budgets and plans
Element Description: Creating reports on a quarterly or annual basis for fund allocation. Create a financial statement that estimates revenues and expenses over a specific period of time. (Leverage budget methods such as cost-based and zero-based budgeting techniques, in light of the periodic targets outlined during Develop and maintain budget policies and procedures [10771].)

Name: Operationalize and implement plans to achieve budget
Element Description: Putting budgeting plans into practical use keeping within designated forecasting parameters.

Name: Prepare periodic financial forecasts
Element Description: Creating estimates of the projected income and expenses required over a predetermined time frame. Develop the projections of profit and loss statements, balance sheets, and the cash flow forecast.

Name: Perform variance analysis against forecasts and budgets
Element Description: Conducting a quantitative analysis between what was forecasted and budgeted and actual financial behavior.

Name: Perform cost accounting and control
Element Description: Defining costs to be incurred and methods for optimum utilization. Determine the costs of products, processes, projects, etc. to compile in the financial statements, as well as to assist management in making decisions regarding planning and control. Control costs by managing and reducing business expenses.

Name: Perform inventory accounting
Element Description: Conducting accounting for assets, and finding reasons for changes (depreciation, obsolescence, deterioration, change in customer taste, increased demand, decreased market supply, etc.).

Name: Perform profit center accounting
Element Description: Determining the revenue, profits, and losses incurred by each unit within the organization that produces profit.

Name: Perform cost of sales analysis
Element Description: Studying expenses directly associated with product. Analyze the cost of sales, which is the cost of manufacturing products.

Name: Perform product costing
Element Description: Studying and finding out the relevant cost center for a product by studying every resource used in its making.

Name: Perform variance analysis
Element Description: Discovering the changes between forecasted and actual costing. Analyze actual and planned behavior by reviewing the amount of a variance on a trend line in order to maintain control over a business.

Name: Report on profitability
Element Description: Making a report about revenues generated by the organization or business unit concerned. This process requires the organization to create a report which shows how business is generating profits. Profits are the part which is left after paying all expenses directly related to the generation of the revenue, such as producing a product, and other expenses related to conducting business activities.

Name: Perform cost management
Element Description: Deciding which expenses can be avoided to reduce some costs and increase revenues. Plan and control the organization's budget to forecast future expenditures.

Name: Determine key cost drivers
Element Description: Defining cost drivers for a particular activity.

Name: Measure cost drivers
Element Description: Calculating cost drivers.

Name: Determine critical activities
Element Description: Determine the activities that hinder the progress of finance activities. This requires the organization to determine those business activities carried out by the financial function of the organization and which are indispensable. This undertaking helps the organization triangulate those activities which are essential and where costs cannot be slashed.

Name: Manage asset resource deployment and utilization
Element Description: Distributing or allocating asset resources in different processes for optimal utilization.

Name: Evaluate and manage financial performance
Element Description: Checking and achieving predetermined financial targets and timelines. Assess and manage the profitability, feasibility, and consistency of a business or project. Study the revenues generated.

Name: Assess customer and product profitability
Element Description: Studying product demand and targeted customer preferences. Study customers' demands or preferences after deducting the cost of delivering the final product.

Name: Evaluate new products
Element Description: Checking demand about a specific product by a customer segment. Conduct a detailed study--or research a customer behavior or preference for a product--in order to determine its production and profitability in a specific market.

Name: Perform life cycle costing
Element Description: Determining the cost of delivering an end product at different stages of production. Study the total life cycle of a product/process to determine how much revenue and production cost will be incurred at every stage in order to make strategic decisions.

Name: Optimize customer and product mix
Element Description: Creating the best fit between a product and the end user. Maximize the customer base by providing different products in the market.

Name: Track performance of new-customer and product strategies
Element Description: Observing the behavior of a new set of customers for different products. Prepare strategies to improve sales and profits.

Name: Prepare activity-based performance measures
Element Description: Evaluating performance based on different sets of activities created by management to measure performance.

Name: Manage continuous cost improvement
Element Description: Conducting activities to improve cost distribution regularly. Follow or adopt different ways of reducing costs.

Name: Perform revenue accounting
Element Description: Comparing revenue targets to reality. Review all transactions and entries passed in final accounts in a year in order to examine profits.

Name: Process customer credit
Element Description: Evaluating and processing requests for advances. Evaluate credit requests by customers requiring loans to buy products/services.

Name: Establish credit policies
Element Description: Creating guidelines for providing advances. Set up credit standards, credit terms, and collection policies.

Name: Analyze/Approve new account applications
Element Description: Checking and accepting new requests based on eligibility criteria. Analyze the status of applicants and requirements to be met for a new account.

Name: Analyze credit scoring history
Element Description: Reviewing past credit scores to determine the if a line of credit will be extended to potential customers. This could also include extending additional credit to existing accounts.

Name: Forecast credit scoring requirement
Element Description: Planning credit score requirements based on established credit policies.

Name: Review existing accounts
Element Description: Evaluating existing account holders and their past performance. Regularly review existing accounts to get the required information about the status at present.

Name: Produce credit/collection reports
Element Description: Preparing account payable reports about payments to be made according to accounting rules and principles, and providing the reports to management.

Name: Reinstate or suspend accounts based on credit policies
Element Description: Closing or restarting accounts according to changes made in credit policies.

Name: Invoice customer
Element Description: Preparing detailed reports of customer purchases. Prepare a commercial document between the seller and customer with details about transaction. Detail the quantity purchased, price of products/services, date, parties involved, unique invoice number, and tax information.

Name: Maintain customer/product master files
Element Description: Creating and updating a record of customers and the products being purchased by them in a database. This process element requires the organization to maintain a database of customers and their purchases.
