Such a master-file can be used to ensure customer touch point, enhance customer satisfaction, explore cross selling opportunities, and identify future trends. This database will include several particulars about the personal details of the organization's customers and a tracking of the products being sold.

Name: Generate customer billing data
Element Description: Preparing detailed reports about products purchased by customers. Record and generate a detail account of transactions made by customers fat a particular time and location. Include all details about products such as price, quantity, and name.

Name: Transmit billing data to customers
Element Description: Providing information to customers about purchases made by them. Communicate the details of purchases. Provide customers with a copy of details for their reference.

Name: Post receivable entries
Element Description: Registering transactions and their scheduled payments.

Name: Resolve customer billing inquiries
Element Description: Checking and solving billing queries raised by customers.

Name: Process accounts receivable (AR)
Element Description: Processing payments due from customers. This includes all processing of funds received, whether by check or electronically. This does not include the generation of invoices.

Name: Establish AR policies
Element Description: Creating rules and regulations to be followed in case of credit sales to customers. Create rules and procedures to follow at the time of sale (e.g., the allowable number of installments).

Name: Receive/Deposit customer payments
Element Description: Collecting cash from customers. Deposit it into bank account. Make entries into the books of accounts.

Name: Apply cash remittances
Element Description: Checking and moving funds between countries for business activities, typically through authorized remittance agents.

Name: Prepare AR reports
Element Description: Preparing reports that detail balances due or what to collect from customers at a certain point in time.

Name: Post AR activity to the general ledger
Element Description: Preparing the general ledger for account receivables from journals. Place all journal entries related to accounts receivables in the general ledger accounts of a business.

Name: Manage and process collections
Element Description: Posting entries to respective accounts, and preparing accounts for receivables. Manage the cash collected by the business from its debtors. Record it in the books of accounts to provide clear information about the availability of the cash.

Name: Establish policies for delinquent accounts
Element Description: Creating a process to follow in case of a failed payment by account holders. Create rules and regulations for the account holder who has failed to make at least the minimum monthly payment by the due date.

Name: Analyze delinquent account balances
Element Description: Examining balance statements of accountholders who failed to make required payments. Study or review the account details of customers' past payments when preparing negotiations policies.

Name: Correspond/Negotiate with delinquent accounts
Element Description: Determine ways for customers in default to repay debts (e.g., allowing more time or discounts).

Name: Discuss account resolution with internal parties
Element Description: Determining rules for handling accounts. Discuss and plan with internal parties (department heads, managers, and senior management) about rules to follow in coming months.

Name: Process adjustments/write off balances
Element Description: Maintaining reserves for write-offs and adjustments. Adjust or write off certain expenses and losses.

Name: Perform recovery workout
Element Description: Renegotiating the terms of a loan agreement in order to recoup money from a default account.

Name: Manage default accounts
Element Description: Managing accounts that have not met the requirements agreed upon to pay off outstanding debts.

Name: Manage and process adjustments/deductions
Element Description: Creating and providing funds for necessary adjustments and deductions, including all expenses that were required for the business at certain point in time.

Name: Establish policies/procedures for adjustments
Element Description: Creating guidelines to follow in case of adjustments to business processes.

Name: Analyze adjustments
Element Description: Checking changes made in accounts during the year. Examine the alterations made in final accounts to rectify errors/omissions.

Name: Correspond/Negotiate with customer
Element Description: Providing suitable offers to customers. Present different offers (e.g., discounts) available for customers or buyers.

Name: Discuss resolution with internal parties
Element Description: Discussing and planning with internal parties (department heads, managers, and senior management) about rules to follow in coming months.

Name: Prepare chargeback invoices
Element Description: Creating a mechanism for consumer protection in case of a higher price charged. When a supplier sells a product at a higher price to the distributor than the price they have set with the end user, submit a chargeback to the supplier to recover the money lost in the transaction.

Name: Process related entries
Element Description: Recording business transactions as they occur in order to provide a balanced accounts for financial reporting.

Name: Perform general accounting and reporting
Element Description: Making statements about business activities and functions. Prepare financial statements (balance sheet, income statement, statement of cash flows, and statement of stockholders' equity) according to accounting concepts and principles.

Name: Manage financial policies and procedures
Element Description: Creating procedures to perform general accounting and reporting. Follow the rules and regulations made for a particular process in the business. Publish accounting policies.

Name: Negotiate service-level agreements
Element Description: Agreeing upon terms and conditions. Negotiate an agreement between two or more parties, the customer and service providers. Specify scope, quality, and responsibilities.

Name: Establish accounting policies
Element Description: Establishing policies and procedures to prepare financial statements, including methods, measurement systems, and procedures for providing disclosures.

Name: Publish accounting policies
Element Description: Creating a written copy of agreed-upon procedures for preparing financial statements, and making them available to the public.

Name: Set and enforce approval limits
Element Description: Implementing parameters for accounting. Apply set conditions for any approval process.

Name: Establish common financial systems
Element Description: Establishing processes and procedures to exercise financial control and accountability. Record, verify, and report transactions that affect revenues, expenditures, assets, and liabilities.

Name: Perform general accounting
Element Description: Applying basic principles, concepts, and accounting practices in recording and preparing final accounts, and using accounting information in management.

Name: Maintain chart of accounts
Element Description: Preparing trial balance account from general ledgers. List all accounts used in the general ledger. Alter accounts according to business requirements.

Name: Process journal entries
Element Description: Making ledger and trial balance accounts from journal entries. This process requires the organization to record every transaction into accounts done by business. It is a base documents for preparing final accounts of company.

Name: Process allocations
Element Description: Allocating funds across functions. Apportion funds in line with the budgets created. Formalize allocations in centralized internal records.

Name: Process period end adjustments
Element Description: Updating journal entries to adjust the balance of income and expenses at the end of an accounting period.

Name: Post and reconcile intercompany transactions
Element Description: Checking accounts separately for a parent and subsidiary company. Manage relationship between a parent company and subsidiaries. Document intercompany transactions in separate financial statements.

Name: Reconcile general ledger accounts
Element Description: Reviewing general ledger accounts for a parent and subsidiaries companies. Validate the integrity of account balances on the company's general ledger of accounts. Review and compare general ledger accounts balances with source documents to ensure that balances match.

Name: Perform consolidations and process eliminations
Element Description: Aggregating different processes in the business. Eliminate discontinued processes.

Name: Prepare trial balance
Element Description: Balancing debit and credit balances of trial balance to preparing final accounts. Calculate the total debits and credits in company's accounts. Correspond the sum of all debits with the sum of all credits. Adjust entries as appropriate.

Name: Prepare and post management adjustments
Element Description: Accounting for changes due to country-level policy changes. Record adjustments made by management in the accounts.

Name: Perform fixed-asset accounting
Element Description: Accounting for long-term and fixed assets. Record purchased, fixed assets that are not easily convertible into cash. Account for costs, useful life, resale value, depreciation, and amortization.

Name: Establish fixed-asset policies and procedures
Element Description: Creating rules for fixed assets market valuation. Make rules and regulations for fixed assets regarding depreciation, provisions, resale, usage, etc.

Name: Maintain fixed-asset master data files
Element Description: Keeping reports up-to-date regarding fixed assets. Create a fixed assets database detailing price, life cycle, depreciation rate, resale value, installation information, usage information, etc.

Name: Process and record fixed-asset additions and retires
Element Description: Keeping a summary of sales and purchases of assets. Record any expenses made for new assets purchased and sales of any old assets during the fiscal year.

Name: Process and record fixed-asset adjustments, enhancements, revaluations, and transfers
Element Description: Keeping a summary of expenses for installing and modifying assets. Record any expenses made for new assets purchased, any expenses incurred on improvements, the valuation of assets to reach current market price, and any transfer assets from one location to another during the fiscal year.

Name: Process and record fixed-asset maintenance and repair expenses
Element Description: Maintaining a record of expenses necessitated for repairs and the preservation of assets. Administer and oversee the maintenance and repair of any fixed assets. Record all related transactions.

Name: Calculate and record depreciation expense
Element Description: Carrying out accounting for depreciation over fixed assets. Compute the sums necessitated. Maintain a record of the cost value of fixed assets over their useful life in the book of accounts.

Name: Reconcile fixed-asset ledger
Element Description: Balancing the ledger account balance for fixed assets. Correct errors in the books of fixed assets. Provide correct information in relevant accounts.

Name: Track fixed-assets including physical inventory
Element Description: Checking and updating the record of all raw materials and fixed assets. Track all fixes asset. Maintain a record of all inventory items.

Name: Provide fixed-asset data to support tax, statutory, and regulatory reporting
Element Description: Showing market value and related expenses on fixed assets data for taxation. Provide complete information recorded in the books of fixed assets about purchase price, depreciation, installation charges, resale market value etc. for tax and regulatory purposes.

Name: Perform financial reporting
Element Description: Reporting on the organization's financial status to stakeholders. Include balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and statements of shareholders' equity.

Name: Prepare business unit financial statements
Element Description: Making reports of subsidiaries units to show profits generated from them. Prepare financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements and statements of shareholders' equity) for a single unit of a business.

Name: Prepare consolidated financial statements
Element Description: Making final accounts for all units of company together. Prepare combined financial statements of a parent company and its subsidiaries (i.e., separate legal entities controlled by a parent company) showing assets, liabilities, equity, income, expenses, and cash flows.

Name: Perform business unit reporting/review management reports
Element Description: Making reports for units/subsidiaries to help management in decision making. Prepare financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and statements of shareholders' equity) for a single unit of a business. Break down profits and losses by function/unit, clients, products, and region.

Name: Perform consolidated reporting/review of cost management reports
Element Description: Making reports for all units to help higher management in decision making. Prepare combined financial statements of a parent company and its all subsidiaries (separate legal entities controlled by a parent company) showing assets, liabilities, equity, income, expenses and cash flows, and also going through periodic reports which shows the actual and estimated costs and their variances.

Name: Prepare statements for board review
Element Description: Preparing a draft of financial statements for the board to review before they are sent to the auditor.

Name: Produce quarterly/annual filings and shareholder reports
Element Description: Making and presenting financial reports to stakeholders. Create annual and quarterly financial statements for reporting purposes. Prepare shareholder reports with details of the profit-and-loss account, balance sheet, and past year's business activities.

Name: Produce regulatory reports
Element Description: Reporting raw or summary data for final accounts following rules and regulations.

Name: Perform legal and management consolidation
Element Description: Carrying out activities associated with legal and management consolidation. Legal consolidation can include currency conversion, balance carry forward, and consolidation of journal entries. Management consolidation can include reporting on financials on a reporting cycle basis to gauge the performance of the organization.

Name: Manage fixed-asset project accounting
Element Description: Managing accounts for large funds-invested projects. Manage and account for fixed assets projects (capital projects), which required significant capital investments over many years.

Name: Perform capital planning and project approval
Element Description: Preparing a project finance report to solicit approvals in capital projects. Prepare budgets for projects that require heavy investments. Report on project finances to solicit approvals from management.

Name: Develop capital investment policies and procedures
Element Description: Creating procedures and policies to follow for investing in capital projects. Create rules and regulations regarding large investment plans, which require in-depth forecasting for expenditure and revenue.

Name: Develop and approve capital expenditure plans and budgets
Element Description: Creating budgets, and soliciting approvals for capital projects. Prepare budgets for projects that require heavy investments. Secure approvals from management.

Name: Review and approve capital projects and fixed-asset acquisitions
Element Description: Evaluating and supporting capital investments in projects and fixed assets. Confirm details of capital projects. Secure approvals from managements for large investments.

Name: Conduct financial justification for project approval
Element Description: Reviewing all project business cases in order to substantiate projected financial gains. Validate any project's business case. Juxtapose the benefits derived from moving a project forward against the associated costs.

Name: Perform capital project accounting
Element Description: Accounting for large-scale and large-cost investments. Manage and account for ongoing activities related to capital projects, including setting up new projects, recording project transactions, monitoring and tracking spending, closing and capitalizing projects, and measuring the financial returns on completed projects.

Name: Create project account codes
Element Description: Giving reference codes for every project.

Name: Record project-related transactions
Element Description: Noting every transaction during a project in a common financial database. Document all transactions associated with any project. Maintain a centralized repository of all such financial data.

Name: Monitor and track capital projects and budget spending
Element Description: Evaluating project progress and funds invested. Observe and track significant funds invested on any long-term project. Compare to budget.

Name: Close/capitalize projects
Element Description: Checking for returns generated from projects for decision making. Evaluate capital projects that require heavy investments. Decide whether to proceed based on the revenues generated.

Name: Measure financial returns on completed capital projects
Element Description: Comparing a finished project's profitability with forecasted returns. Scrutinize revenues generated by completed projects that required heavy investments. Determine profitability.

Name: Process payroll
Element Description: Handling reporting time, managing pay, and processing taxes from salaries. Pay employees. Withhold taxes. Confirm the correct funds are paid to the correct government agency.

Name: Report time
Element Description: Recording the reporting time of employees on-site. Track working days, salary calculations, holidays taken, number of hours spend in the office, billing hours, etc.

Name: Establish policies and procedures
Element Description: Developing policies and procedures for the HR function to calculate compensation.

Name: Collect and record employee time worked
Element Description: Tracking billing hours of each employee on daily basis.

Name: Analyze and report paid and unpaid leave
Element Description: Tracking leaves allowed and taken by employees.

Name: Monitor regular, overtime, and other hours
Element Description: Observing the number of hours worked by an employees on daily basis. Track the number of hours worked by an employee, as well as the number of hours worked beyond normal working hour's according to company standards.

Name: Analyze and report employee utilization
Element Description: Monitoring the number of productive hours for employees.

Name: Manage pay
Element Description: Managing the total payments made in employees payroll, including bonuses and compensation.

Name: Enter employee time worked into payroll system
Element Description: Tracking the number of hours worked for the payroll system. Register the number of hours worked by an employee into the payroll system for the purpose of calculating salaries or wages.

Name: Maintain and administer employee earnings information
Element Description: Tracking and oversee salary breakups of employees. This process requires the organization to manage and update information pertaining to the structure of every employee's salary. This would involve the updating any changes to the salary structures of the employees, in a central repository which can be accessed by pertinent departments.

Name: Maintain and administer applicable deductions
Element Description: Processing salary deductions for tax purposes. Keep and manage the details of every employee's salary deductions based on their expenses and investments during the year.

Name: Monitor changes in tax status of employees
Element Description: Tracking changes in the salary structure of employees for tax deductions.

Name: Process and distribute payments
Element Description: Processing and distributing salaries to all employees. Execute the payroll management function through the dispensation of employee salaries. Leverage a centralized database of all payroll expenses.

Name: Process and distribute manual checks
Element Description: Handling incorrect/omitted salary payments.

Name: Process period-end adjustments
Element Description: Adjusting salary deductions for tax purposes at the end of the year.

Name: Respond to employee payroll inquiries
Element Description: Addressing salary-related queries raised by employees.

Name: Manage and process payroll taxes
Element Description: Deducting and paying taxes from employees' salaries.

Name: Develop tax plan
Element Description: Devising a method to minimize payroll tax liability by means of allowances, deductions, exclusions or exemptions.

Name: Manage tax plan
Element Description: Overseeing maintaining the reduction of payroll taxes [14075].

Name: Calculate and pay applicable payroll taxes
Element Description: Paying tax according to appropriate deductions made from salaries. Calculate and pay the tax liabilities according to the salaries and tax regulations of employees with the help of certified chartered accountants.

Name: Produce and distribute employee annual tax statements
Element Description: Providing tax deductions statements created by certified chartered accountants to every employee for their reference or refunds.

Name: File regulatory payroll tax forms
Element Description: Filling taxes, and highlighting different sources of income and expenditures made.

Name: Process accounts payable and expense reimbursements
Element Description: Handling bills and reimbursements to be made. Make payments for goods or services taken or used on behalf of the organization.

Name: Process accounts payable (AP)
Element Description: Processing payments of operating expenses and other supplier charges. This includes the development of policies and procedures around processing of accounts payable and all operations. This process is often supported by key technology enablers.

Name: Verify AP pay file with purchase order vendor master file
Element Description: Matching records of bills to be paid with accounts. Check accounts payable entries with vendor's account for every payment made.

Name: Maintain/Manage electronic commerce
Element Description: Tracking all online transactions.

Name: Audit invoices and key data in AP system
Element Description: Monitoring and evaluating bills registered in accounts books. Check all invoices. Maintain records.

Name: Approve payments
Element Description: Processing payments for products/services.

Name: Process financial accruals and reversals
Element Description: Handling transactions for accruals and reversals. Record transactions in the books of accounts on an accrual basis (irrespective of the actual cash flow) and reversals basis (cancel out the adjusting entries) for balancing accounts.

Name: Process payables taxes
Element Description: Filing the amount of taxes that a company owes as of the balance sheet date. Prepare tax returns, including the income tax filing for an individual or business entity from earnings.

Name: Research/Resolve payable exceptions
Element Description: Resolving any atypical or inconsistent situation concerning payments to be made by the organization. Address any exceptional case of accounts payable on an ad hoc basis, by seeking counsel or carrying out any necessary research.

Name: Process payments
Element Description: Making payments for products/services on due dates (payment cycle) decided by parties involved.

Name: Respond to AP inquiries
Element Description: Clarifying or address queries relating to the particulars of AP such as date, discounts, amount, and installments. Coordinate with concerned parties about the fulfillment of bills payable.

Name: Retain records
Element Description: Keeping bills of every transaction for future reference.

Name: Adjust accounting records
Element Description: Rectifying for alterations occurred in accounts while recording.

Name: Process expense reimbursements
Element Description: Processing reimbursements to employees for the expenses incurred during the course of business. Approve and process advancements and reimbursements for employee expenses on the organization's behalf. Capture and report relevant tax data and manage personal accounts.

Name: Establish and communicate expense reimbursement policies and approval limits
Element Description: Explaining policies and procedures related to reimbursements requests by employees. Set policies regarding reimbursement process and amount limits etc. Inform employees.

Name: Capture and report relevant tax data
Element Description: Collecting and reporting all pertinent information regarding the taxes paid by the organization's employees.

Name: Approve reimbursements and advances
Element Description: Permitting expense reimbursement requests from employees.

Name: Process reimbursements and advances
Element Description: Paying for expense reimbursement requests from employees. (Follow Approve reimbursements and advances [10882] according to policies and conditions.)

Name: Manage personnel accounts
Element Description: Maintaining accounts of individuals who are connected with business.

Name: Manage corporate credit cards
Element Description: Handling and authoring credit cards to business entities or for corporate purchases.

Name: Establish corporate credit card policies and approval limits
Element Description: Developing procedures for using company credit cards. Set or approve credit limits.

Name: Process corporate credit card requests
Element Description: Handling applications credit card applications for business expenses.

Name: Order corporate credit cards
Element Description: Obtaining credit cards for business-related expenses.

Name: Manage corporate credit card accounts
Element Description: Handling credit card accounts of business customers.

Name: Approve/Change credit limits
Element Description: Authorizing changes to the available credit advances.

Name: Cancel/Deactivate credit card
Element Description: Blocking an existing credit card to disable all future transactions.

Name: Manage treasury operations
Element Description: Managing business's investments in trading in bonds, currencies, financial derivatives, etc. Manage the financial assets and holdings of the organization. Optimize the organization's liquidity. Invest excess cash. Reduce financial risks.

Name: Manage treasury policies and procedures
Element Description: Managing rules and regulations for investments in trading in bonds, currencies, financial derivatives, etc. Establish policies and procedures for investments made. Optimize liquidity in treasury operations.

Name: Establish scope and governance of treasury operations
Element Description: Selecting opportunities and the authoritative body for investments in trading in bonds, currencies, financial derivatives, etc.

Name: Establish and publish treasury policies
Element Description: Creating and providing investment regulations for the organization. Establish policies and procedures for investments to optimize liquidity in treasury operations. Create a written copy of it.

Name: Develop treasury procedures
Element Description: Making processes for investing. Create steps for investments in bonds, currencies, and financial derivatives in order to optimize company's liquidity, invest excess cash, and reduce its financial risks.

Name: Monitor treasury procedures
Element Description: Checking treasury processes in order to optimize company's liquidity, invest excess cash, and reduce its financial risks.

Name: Audit treasury procedures
Element Description: Auditing the treasury function.

Name: Revise treasury procedures
Element Description: Reassessing all treasury procedures based on audit findings.

Name: Develop and confirm internal controls for treasury
Element Description: Creating and managing the internal control systems for investments in bonds, currencies, and financial derivatives to verify procedures.

Name: Define system security requirements
Element Description: Describing the need of system security requirements for controlling access, reliability of information, accountability, and availability of information in the organization.

Name: Manage cash
Element Description: Taking care of all cash-related activities in the business. Manage and reconcile cash positions. Manage cash equivalents. Process and oversee electronic fund transfers. Develop cash flow forecasts. Manage cash flows. Produce cash management accounting transactions and reports. Manage and oversee banking relationships. Analyze, negotiate, resolve, and confirm bank fees.

Name: Manage and reconcile cash positions
Element Description: Correcting cash differences in the books of accounts. Make optimum utilization of funds available in the business. Check for differences to rectify.

Name: Manage cash equivalents
Element Description: Taking care of all cash-related activities in the business. Utilize short-term assets that can be easily convertible into cash, such as marketable securities, commercial paper and short-term government bonds, and treasury bills.

Name: Process and oversee electronic fund transfers (EFTs)
Element Description: Supervising all online transactions.

Name: Develop cash flow forecasts
Element Description: Preparing forecasts for the cash generated or used by the organization.

Name: Manage cash flows
Element Description: Delaying the outflow of funds as long as possible, but encourage the inflow of as fast as possible.

Name: Produce cash management accounting transactions and reports
Element Description: Presenting reports on all cash-related activities. Collect and manage short-term investing activities. Prepare reports of all transactions done.

Name: Manage and oversee banking relationships
Element Description: Maintaining and directing the course of relationships with banking partners.

Name: Analyze, negotiate, resolve, and confirm bank fees
Element Description: Studying and finalizing bank fees for services provided by banks. Negotiate and finalize nominal fees that bank charges for various services, such as requesting a deposit slip or counter check or certifying papers.

Name: Manage in-house bank accounts
Element Description: Managing financial services provided by an in-house bank structure in the corporation that is operating like a commercial bank.

Name: Manage in-house bank accounts for subsidiaries
Element Description: Maintaining subsidiaries' company accounts opened with bank inside the corporation. Manage different financial services provided by in-house bank structure for parent companies' subsidiaries or branches.

Name: Manage and facilitate inter-company borrowing transactions
Element Description: Arranging loans for subsidiaries from in-house banks.

Name: Manage centralized outgoing payments on behalf of subsidiaries
Element Description: Handling payments made for subsidiaries by parent company.

Name: Manage central incoming payments on behalf of subsidiaries
Element Description: Handling payments received by parent company for subsidiaries.

Name: Manage internal payments and netting transactions
Element Description: Taking care of all business outflows and recording as whole. Manage making all payments for the organization and its units or subsidiaries. Track in books of accounts of parent company.

Name: Calculate interest and fees for in-house bank accounts
Element Description: Computing all expenses paid to and receivables collected over the organization's banking activity. Calculate all charges and receivables, towards interest, fees, and any other payments over its own bank accounts. Record transactions in the books of accounts.

Name: Provide account statements for in-house bank accounts
Element Description: Facilitating account statements for all in-house banking activity.

Name: Manage debt and investment
Element Description: Taking care of the organization's financial position. Manage its loans or debts from different sources and investments. Leverage the most profitable options to balance the financial position in the market.

Name: Establish investment policy
Element Description: Developing and instituting principles that the organization ill use in making investments.

Name: Manage financial intermediary relationships
Element Description: Maintaining smooth relations with financial investment banks that help availing loans and services.

Name: Manage liquidity
Element Description: Managing and maintaining enough liquidity in form of cash and cash equivalents in the business to meet urgent and timely requirements

Name: Manage issuer exposure
Element Description: Managing the exposure incurred by the issuer for providing credit to the borrower.

Name: Process and oversee debt and investment transactions
Element Description: Tracking loans taken and money invested in different options. Arrange and supervise loans from banks and individuals and investments in different available and profitable options.

Name: Process and oversee foreign currency transactions
Element Description: Arranging and supervising foreign exchange rate changes to avoid loss on foreign-currency transactions.

Name: Produce debt and investment accounting transaction reports
Element Description: Creating transactions report of loans and investments. Prepare and maintain records of loans and investment transactions.

Name: Process and oversee interest rate transactions
Element Description: Supervising the interest paid or received by the organization. Arrange and supervise interest rate swap transactions to manage exposure to fluctuations in interest rates. Or attain a marginally lower rate of interest than could be gained through a swap.

Name: Monitor and execute risk and hedging transactions
Element Description: Performing transactions that limit investment risk with the help of derivatives, such as options and futures contracts. Manage interest rates, foreign exchange, and exposure risks. Develop and execute hedging transactions. Evaluate and refine hedging positions. Produce hedge accounting transactions and reports. Monitor credit.

Name: Develop risk management/hedging strategy
Element Description: Taking an investment position to offset exposure to certain risks. This may include purchasing opposite of the organization's position in the marketplace, using derivatives transactions, or futures contracts.

Name: Manage interest rate risk
Element Description: Handling risks arising from changes in the interest rate.

Name: Manage interest rate market data
Element Description: Collecting and storing data that pertains to interest rate markets.

Name: Determine interest rate exposure for all markets
Element Description: Identifying potential interest rate risks for all markets.

Name: Determine interest rate hedge requirements in accordance with risk policy
Element Description: Deciding the requirements on interest rate investments that are made by trading in futures or options market, on the basis of the accepted risk policy.

Name: Execute interest rate trades
Element Description: Performing trading on interest rates.

Name: Manage foreign exchange risk
Element Description: Taking care of foreign-exchange risks.

Name: Manage foreign exchange market data
Element Description: Handling and processing information about changes in foreign exchange rates.

Name: Determine foreign exchange exposure for all currencies
Element Description: Establishing potential foreign exchange risks for all currencies.

Name: Determine foreign exchange hedge requirements in accordance with risk policy
Element Description: Deciding the requirements on investments in foreign exchange made by trading in futures or options market, on the basis of current risk policy.

Name: Execute foreign exchange trades
Element Description: Executing all aspects for foreign exchange trade within foreign exchange market. This includes buying, selling, and exchanging currencies at the current or expressed price point.

Name: Manage foreign exchange balance sheet risk
Element Description: Overseeing the foreign exchange balance sheet with an eye towards potential risk. Risks include changes in conversion rates between the time the transaction occurred and when it is completed, or when transactions are made in a denomination other than that of the organization's base currency.

Name: Manage exposure risk
Element Description: Taking care of exposure risks. Maintain financial investments in particular investments or a portfolios that could be risky for the organization.

Name: Determine current customer exposures and limit exceptions
Element Description: Establishing ongoing risks that the customers face, and the exceptions to exceeded limits.

Name: Resolve customer exposure limit violations
Element Description: Settling cases that involve violations of customer exposure limit.

Name: Manage customer collateral
Element Description: Handling customer securities to recover loans that are not paid back.

Name: Perform annual customer credit reviews
Element Description: Conducting reviews to assess customer credit on a yearly basis. Introduce changes or make recommendations, if needed.

Name: Execute hedging transactions
Element Description: Implementing hedging strategy in attempt to alleviate risk. This will include all options, depravities, and futures contracts agreed upon in Develop risk management/hedging strategy [12974].

Name: Measure physical positions
Element Description: Evaluating investments made in some market to offset the risks of investing in a contrary or opposing market.

Name: Establish hedges
Element Description: Determining which hedge options to execute.

Name: Unwind hedges
Element Description: Closing out a position or cashing in derivatives early.

Name: Evaluate and refine hedging positions
Element Description: Examining options in the market for hedging investments. Select an option.

Name: Monitor credit
Element Description: Revising credit reports periodically for accurateness and changes that could be suggestive of duplicitous activity.

Name: Produce hedge accounting transactions and reports
Element Description: Preparing and documenting accounts and records of all hedging investment transactions to reduce risks due to change in markets.

Name: Manage financial fraud/dispute cases
Element Description: Handling cases that involve financial fraud. Resolve disputes.

Name: Manage internal controls
Element Description: Administering internal controls. This process requires the organization to manage entity's board of trustees, management, and other personnel in order to offer judicious assurance about the achievement of effectiveness, proficiency of operations, and reliability of financial reporting.

Name: Establish internal controls, policies, and procedures
Element Description: Forming rules and regulations to ensure the achievement of effectiveness, proficiency of operations, and reliability of financial reporting.

Name: Establish board of directors and audit committee
Element Description: Establishing board of directors and auditing committee in order to assign roles and responsibilities for internal controls.

Name: Define and communicate code of ethics
Element Description: Outlining and communicating a code of ethics act responsibly.

Name: Assign roles and responsibility for internal controls
Element Description: Defining roles, responsibilities, and accountabilities for effectiveness and proficiency of operations and reliability of financial reporting.

Name: Define business process objectives and risks
Element Description: Outlining the objectives and risks associated with a process. Delineate process goals. Determine the risks attached to it. Determine what the process is meant to accomplish, potential issues, a timeline of potential risks, the scope and potential impact of risks, etc.

Name: Define entity/unit risk tolerances
Element Description: Outlining the risk tolerance levels of individual units, as well as the organization as a whole. Determine the specific maximum risk to take in quantitative terms for each relevant risk subcategory, including strategic, operational, financial, and compliance risks.

Name: Operate controls and monitor compliance with internal controls policies and procedures
Element Description: Performing planning, management, operations, and monitoring of internal control mechanism policies and procedures in order to manage internal controls.

Name: Monitor control effectiveness
Element Description: Overseeing the activities for internal controls. Observe the effectiveness of policies, procedures, techniques, and mechanisms actions taken to minimize risk.

Name: Remediate control deficiencies
Element Description: Taking corrective measures for policies, procedures, techniques, and mechanisms actions taken to minimize risk. (Conduct in accordance with Monitor control effectiveness [10918] in order to determine and rectify the control deficiencies.)

Name: Report on internal controls compliance
Element Description: Reporting on internal controls compliance to the appropriate authority, including IT regulations and pertinent data.

Name: Report to external auditors
Element Description: Reporting to external auditors. This process requires the organization to report to external auditors about the regulations for any critical data that the organization is holding.

Name: Report to regulators, share-/debt-holders, securities exchanges, etc.
Element Description: Reporting to regulators, shareholders, debt holders, securities exchanges, etc. about IT regulations and pertinent data.

Name: Report to third parties
Element Description: Reporting to suppliers, customers, and partners that are doing business with the company about IT regulations and pertinent data.

Name: Report to internal management
Element Description: Reporting to internal management (all employees, directors, and management) about IT regulations and pertinent data.

Name: Manage taxes
Element Description: Estimating the organization's periodic tax liabilities. Ensure that appropriate taxing authorities receive tax return filings and payments when due.

Name: Develop tax strategy and plan
Element Description: Setting targets for periodic tax liabilities. Assess the tax impact of various activities such as the acquisition or disposal of fixed assets or a deliberate change in number of employee.

Name: Develop foreign, national, state, and local tax strategy
Element Description: Developing a tax strategy for foreign, national, state, local administration. Set up tax strategies for foreign trade in imports and exports and at national, state, and local level.

Name: Consolidate and optimize total tax plan
Element Description: Combining and enhancing a rational analysis of a financial condition or plan from a tax perspective in order to align financial goals through efficient tax planning.

Name: Maintain tax master data
Element Description: Maintaining a master file about the rational analysis of a financial condition or plan from a tax perspective in order to align financial goals through efficient tax planning.

Name: Process taxes
Element Description: Processing the taxes of the organization in line with the regional taxation structure, including corporate, property, excise, and service taxes.

Name: Perform tax planning/strategy
Element Description: Creating and implementing strategies for taxes to be paid or collected by the business.

Name: Prepare tax returns
Element Description: Preparing and submitting tax reports for every employee to the tax department in order to show the tax paid and deducted from their salaries in the year.

Name: Prepare foreign taxes
Element Description: Preparing reports about paid or accrued foreign taxes to an overseas country.

Name: Calculate deferred taxes
Element Description: Calculating the income that has been realized when the tax on that income has not.

Name: Account for taxes
Element Description: Managing the organization's financial accounts for the purpose of taxation. Prepare and maintain the tax paid by the organization to the country they have business in.

Name: Monitor tax compliance
Element Description: Checking and correcting the tax policies according to the rules and regulations set by the organization.

Name: Address tax inquiries
Element Description: Addressing any tax queries by any regulatory or government authorities. Review historical records related to taxation within the organization in order to respond to queries.

Name: Manage international funds/consolidation
Element Description: Managing cash collections and disbursements made by operating units across the enterprise. When appropriate, transfer cash from the operating units to parent-level bank accounts managed by the organization's treasury team.

Name: Monitor international rates
Element Description: Forecasting and monitoring changes in foreign currency value or interest rates around the world that play an important role in the organization.

Name: Manage transactions
Element Description: Managing any transfer of funds in the course of conducting cross-border trades or investments, including conversion across currencies. Find the most suitable alternative for making payments, while saving taxes and avoiding any unwarranted regulation, with the objective of protecting capital.

Name: Monitor currency exposure/hedge currency
Element Description: Assessing exposure to potential financial losses as a result of changes in the value of currencies. Forecast the impact of movements in foreign currency values. Enter into financial transactions designed to offset or limit potential exposure to loss.

Name: Report results
Element Description: Documenting and reporting accounting entries to formally report financial gains or losses experienced as a result of foreign exchange activity.

Name: Perform global trade services
Element Description: Making and collecting payments for transactions in products/services, and transporting them to interested markets.

Name: Screen sanctioned party list
Element Description: Evaluating the approved list of parties for engaging in international trade in order to ensure the safety of the organization's business transactions. Examine agents that have been granted legal rights to engage in global trade and their credentials.

Name: Control exports and imports
Element Description: Overseeing and directing the flow of trade to/from the organization in order to ensure financial gains.

Name: Classify products
Element Description: Systematically categorizing products/services for their suitability to international trade. Create classes and categories for demarcating the types of products suitable for international trade. Study requisite national and international standards and the adherence of the organization's portfolio of offerings to these.

Name: Perform currency conversion
Element Description: Identifying current exchange rates between two currencies and converting the foreign currency to that of the local monetary unit. I.E., yen to US dollar.

Name: Calculate duty
Element Description: Computing the excise duty to be paid during international trade.

Name: Communicate with customs
Element Description: Communicating with the customs department to ensure fluid compliance. Share pertinent information mandated by law with the government agency that controls and collects the duties levied for the international exchange of products/services.

Name: Document trade
Element Description: Documenting and recording the trade processes while making transactions, noting the description, quality, number, transportation medium, indemnity, and inspection.

Name: Process trade preferences
Element Description: Preparing global trade under preference, which allows the organization to import/export products at a lower or nil rate of customs duty and/or levy charge.

Name: Handle restitution
Element Description: Administering and overseeing all restitution activities the organization may be subjected to. Manage compliance with apposite legal frameworks. Make any restitution that may be required by law; comply with authorities over any fines or non-financial measures imposed.

Name: Prepare letter of credit
Element Description: Creating a document assuring that a seller will receive payment when certain delivery conditions are met. (If the buyer is unable to make payment on the purchase, a bank covers the outstanding amount.)

Name: Acquire, Construct, and Manage Assets
Element Description: Relating to the design, construction, acquisition, and management of both productive and non-productive assets.

Name: Plan and acquire assets
Element Description: Planning, acquiring, and managing facilities, workspaces, and supporting assets. Acquire, configure, and manage facilities and workspaces, to include supporting equipment and materials.

Name: Develop property strategy and long term vision
Element Description: Strategizing a long-term vision for managing properties. Prepare strategies and a long-term vision for managing purchased/retained properties.

Name: Confirm alignment of property requirements with business strategy
Element Description: Creating alignment between the requirement of properties and the overall business strategy. This process requires the organization to align the requirement of properties in accordance with its business strategies of the organization.

Name: Appraise the external environment
Element Description: Evaluating the impact of the external environment. Evaluate the circumstances, objects, events, and aspects surrounding an organization that affects its actions and selections and that recognizes its opportunities and risks.

Name: Determine build, buy, or lease decision
Change details: RENAME, WAS:Determine build or buy decision
Element Description: Deciding whether to buy or build properties. Study the market forces about property prices and cost of construction in order to take decisions based on the market research.

Name: Plan facility
Element Description: Recognizing the needs of facility users in order to construct a project proposal that meets those needs.

Name: Design facility
Element Description: Preparing and analyzing different designs for a facility in order to finalize which design will be the most suitable option.

Name: Analyze budget
Element Description: Evaluating the feasibility of budgets prepared for the construction of facilities.

Name: Select property
Element Description: Assessing and choosing the appropriate property. Analyze the property requirements. Review the available property options. Finalize the most suitable option.

Name: Negotiate terms for facility
Element Description: Discussing the terms and conditions of facilities to be occupied according to the business requirements and availability of budgets.

Name: Manage construction or modification to building
Element Description: Constructing the buildings. Manage renovations according to requirements and demands.

Name: Provide workspace and facilities
Element Description: Managing the provision of the workspace and its assets. Arrange an office space with all assets (tables, chairs, computers, admin staff, etc.) according to requirements.

Name: Acquire workspace and facilities
Element Description: Attaining the office space with all assets (tables, chairs, computers, admin staff, etc.) according to requirements.

Name: Change fit/form/function of workspace and facilities
Element Description: Modifying the formation of the workspace and its assets. Make necessary changes in an office space with all assets (tables, chairs, computers, admin staff, interior designing, etc.) according to requirements.

Name: Manage facilities operations
Element Description: Managing all operational activities of the facility. Manage how each function/business unit works. Support the manufacturing facility to attain organizational goals.

Name: Relocate people
Element Description: Shifting staff or employees from one place to another place according to changes in business requirements.

Name: Relocate material and tools
Element Description: Relocating the tools and raw materials. Shift raw or finished material and machines of company from one place to another place according to changes in business requirements.

Name: Design and construct assets
Element Description: Designing and constructing assets such as machines, tools, factories, etc. Manage steps to acquire assets including managing capital, as well as planning, scheduling, and overseeing acquisition/construction.

Name: Manage capital program for assets
Change details: RENAME, WAS:Manage capital program for productive assets
Element Description: Producing and maintaining a planning schedule and a financial plan to purchase or manufacture productive assets. Determine the investment plan, monitor capital, and secure the necessary financing in order to realize completion of the program.

Name: Define capital investment plan
Element Description: Establishing what funds will be invested in the construction of productive assets for the advancement of established business objectives.

Name: Monitor capital program
Element Description: Monitoring plans on capital projects. Capital projects can be purchasing buildings, lands, etc.

Name: Secure construction financing
Element Description: Acquiring the loans needed to construct necessary assets.

Name: Design and plan asset construction
Element Description: Outlining the steps and strategies needed to construct assets. Verify that all regulations are adhered to and that all permissions have been granted. Organize and plan for resources to complete construction.

Name: Develop construction strategy
Element Description: Developing a strategy to perform asset construction. Assure that timelines, regulations, and resources are on task and on budget.

Name: Perform construction performance management
Element Description: Managing the construction process to ensure that activates are on task, on budget, and are being performed with safety and quality in mind.

Name: Obtain construction permissions
Element Description: Gathering the required permits for construction from the proper jurisdiction. This may include inspections during and after construction to verify that the new asset meets all national, regional, and local codes.

Name: Design assets
Element Description: Designing assets to meet organizational needs as well as ensuring that the asset adheres to all national, regional, and local construction codes.

Name: Plan construction resources
Element Description: Determining what resources will need to be acquired in order to carry out construction. Plan when, where, and how resources will be used. Determine the length of time resources will be utilized.

Name: Schedule and perform construction work
Element Description: Arranging a timetable for which to perform construction work. Schedule resources to contract assets for new or replacement assets. Reschedule or redesign assets if needed.

Name: Schedule construction work
Element Description: Defining a timetable for which to execute the construction of the asset.

Name: Obtain resources
Element Description: Gathering resources needed to complete all construction work. Verify that all resources have the proper training and skills to perform the work.

Name: Construct new assets
Element Description: Building new assets necessary for the organization. Be aware of any construction codes and permits that need to be addressed.

Name: Augment existing assets
Element Description: Modifying existing assets to align with the changing needs of the organization. Be aware of any construction codes and permits that need to be addressed.

Name: Renew/Replace assets
Element Description: Determining the need to replace existing assets. Be aware of any construction codes and permits that need to be addressed.

Name: Manage asset construction
Element Description: Overseeing the performance and quality of work. Assure that records are maintained throughout the construction process. Adhere to all safety, security, and access regulations set forth by the organization and all government standards.

Name: Monitor work performance
Element Description: Monitoring construction to insure that all regulatory laws are being adhered to, that all work is being performed in a timely manner, and that quality assurance is met at all steps of the construction process.

Name: Undertake construction quality control
Element Description: Implementing a checks and balances system to verify that the construction was performed correctly. Rework when errors are found.

Name: Create work and asset records
Element Description: Implementing records to include all construction work that has been performed. Include all new or modified construction, and any construction or regulatory issues that might have occurred.

Name: Manage safety, security, and access to sites
Element Description: Ensuring that safety, security, and access is maintained. Provide a workplace that meets and exceeds all local, state, and federal guidelines. Provide security and access to the building site as set forth by safety and organizational guidelines.

Name: Maintain assets
Element Description: Preserving productive assets through the planning, managing, and performance of preventative, routine, and critical maintenance work.

Name: Plan asset maintenance
Element Description: Ensuring that necessary resources are available and tasks are prioritized accordingly through planning. Provide strategies and policies that identify tasks that need to be completed, and the resources necessary to fulfill those tasks.

Name: Develop maintenance strategies
Element Description: Creating goals and agendas to better realize the success of the maintenance policies that have been put into place.

Name: Analyze assets and predict maintenance requirements
Element Description: Evaluating assets in order to project future requirements for maintenance. Evaluate the present working condition of assets. Determine the future maintenance requirements of assets.

Name: Specify maintenance policies
Element Description: Communicating policies in regards to asset maintenance. Provide a clear set of procedures and policies that outline what will be involved in the maintenance process.

Name: Integrate preventive maintenance into operations schedule
Element Description: Devising a methodology and procedure for assimilating the works of planned maintenance into the schedule scheme for the processing of finished products that utilizes the same machinery.

Name: Identify work management tasks & priorities
Element Description: Identifying the steps needed for asset maintenance. List out the those tasks that are involved in completing this process. Prioritize the tasks that are created.

Name: Conduct resource planning
Element Description: Analyzing workload needs in relation to asset maintenance and plan resources around those needs.

Name: Create work plans
Element Description: Creating procedures on how to maintain productive assets.

Name: Manage asset maintenance
Element Description: Ensuring that asset maintenance is conducted in a timely manner and successfully. Schedule work with the required resources with an eye on quality control and safety. Verify that contracted maintenance meets performance targets.

Name: Schedule maintenance work
Element Description: Defining a timetable for which to execute the maintenance of the asset.

Name: Obtain required resources
Element Description: Gathering resources needed to complete all maintenance work. Verify that all resources have the proper training and skills to perform the work.

Name: Undertake quality control
Element Description: Implementing a checks and balances system to verify that the maintenance was performed correctly. Rework when errors are found.

Name: Update work and asset records
Element Description: Modifying existing maintenance records to include all new work that has been performed, what assets were serviced, and any issues that might have arisen.

Name: Manage maintenance work safety
Element Description: Assuring that all safety laws and regulations are being implemented and followed. Align practices with regulatory bureaus such as OSHA , EHS, and ISO.

Name: Define maintenance performance targets
Element Description: Outlining what should be achieved through predictive indicators with regard to performing maintenance. This could include the length of time it takes to perform routine maintenance or how often unplanned maintenance feasibly occur.

Name: Monitor maintenance performance against targets/contracts
Element Description: Following set performance targets, monitor and gage the success of the organization in meeting those targets.

Name: Perform asset maintenance
Element Description: Engaging in all aspects of asset maintenance. Ensure that all assets are functioning properly and to all specified codes and regulations where applicable. Maintenance includes all preventative, routine, and corrective activates.

Name: Perform preventative asset maintenance
Element Description: Performing prophylactic maintenance in an effort to avoid corrective or unplanned repairs.

Name: Perform routine asset maintenance
Element Description: Carrying out required maintenance to continue upkeep of equipment or assets.

Name: Perform corrective asset maintenance and repairs
Element Description: Repairing or correcting faults that occur with an asset. This could be a break or other repairable damage.

Name: Identify unplanned maintenance requirements
Element Description: Realizing potential or current problems with assets that would require unplanned maintenance. Unplanned maintenance is a repair or change that needs to be made that is not preventative or routine.

Name: Perform unplanned maintenance and repairs
Element Description: Performing repairs that occur outside of normal routine or preventative maintenance.

Name: Manage asset end-of-life
Element Description: Managing the disposition of assets at their end-of-life. End-of-life for an asset may be due to obsolescence, replacement, excess capacity, or disrepair among other potential factors. Steps may include decommissioning, disassembly, recycling, etc. Tracking and reporting may also be appropriate for some or all asset types due to law, regulation, or social/environmental responsibility.

Name: Develop exit strategy
Element Description: Creating a strategy for managing asset exits.

Name: Monitor useful life of assets
Element Description: Monitoring assets against their planned useful life. Each asset may have specific criteria that indicate their usability. This may include time-based, maintenance history, capacity planning, etc.

Name: Perform cost vs. benefit analysis for replacement
Element Description: Cost/benefit analysis of assets to determine retention or end-of-life. Evaluating asset total lifecycle cost against other factors such as repair/refurbishment, replacement, and alternate solutions.

Name: Decommission productive assets
Element Description: Retiring assets that are no longer viable to the business. Decommission assets that are no longer in working order, are out of date, or whose maintenance exceeds the cost of replacement.

Name: Perform sale or trade
Element Description: Performing the sale of assets. Achieve and complete the sale process. Deliver the end product to the customers.

Name: Manage take-back centers
Element Description: Managing locations where end-of-life assets are evaluated for decommissioning, disassembly, recycling, etc.

Name: Dismantle assets
Element Description: Dismantling an asset into manageable parts. The parts may follow different dispositions, such as resale, reuse, recycle, etc.

Name: Track parts
Element Description: Tracking the disposition of all parts from end-of-life assets. Tracking should provide an audit trail to include source, rational for disposition, and destination.

Name: Recycle parts
Element Description: Recycling parts in accordance with legal, regulatory, and social/environmental responsibilities.

Name: Ship hazardous material
Element Description: Planning, conducting, and tracking shipment of hazardous materials.

Name: Provide government reporting
Element Description: Preparing and distributing government reports.

Name: Perform abandonment
Element Description: Planning and performing abandonment activities. Whether facilities  or equipment, ensure assets to be abandoned are safe, secure, and meet all legal, regulatory, and social/environmental responsibilities.

Name: Demolish and secure
Element Description: Demolishing and securing asset and resulting parts/debris.

Name: Restore site
Element Description: Performing remediation or restoration activities.

Name: Monitor site for duration of time required by regulators
Element Description: Managing and reporting site status. Align efforts to all legal, regulatory and social/environmental responsibilities.

Name: Prepare handover to new operator or landowner
Element Description: Supporting handover to new operator or landowner. Include proper documentation on asset history and current state to enable orderly transition.

Name: Perform waste and hazardous goods management
Element Description: Planning and performing waste and hazardous goods management. In compliance with all legal, regulatory, and social/environmental requirements, plan, document, and conduct hazardous material handling, disposal, and reporting.

Name: Maintain material safety data sheets
Element Description: Preparing material safety sheets. Capture material safety records to properly apply handling and disposal requirements.

Name: Maintain awareness of and communicate regulatory requirements
Element Description: Understanding and communicating hazardous material regulatory requirements.

Name: Maintain hazardous material handling and disposal
Element Description: Planning, overseeing, and tracking hazardous material handling and disposal.

Name: Manage compliance audits
Element Description: Planning, supporting, and documenting hazardous material audits.

Name: Recognize need to disposition hazardous materials/waste
Element Description: Identifying and establishing approaches to dispose of hazardous materials/waste.

Name: Determine disposition and associated processing
Element Description: Evaluating hazardous materials and waste for appropriate disposition. Apply requirements and initiate disposition activities.

Name: Manage disposition, disposal, reprocessing activities
Element Description: Performing disposition, disposal, and reprocessing activities.

Name: Manage documentation and reporting
Element Description: Documenting and reporting disposition, disposal, and reprocessing activities.

Name: Manage Enterprise Risk, Compliance, Remediation, and Resiliency
Element Description: Ensuring that an organization effectively manages its risk. Process groups are aligned with traditional risk management activities.

Name: Manage enterprise risk
Element Description: Creating requisite frameworks and coordinating all risk management activities for the entire organization and each function. Manage the enterprise risk by outlining the risk policies and procedures. Monitor and communicate all risk management activities. Encourage correspondence among the business units. Manage the risk of all business units and functions.

Name: Establish the enterprise risk framework and policies
Element Description: Creating an agenda for the rules and regulations of enterprise risk that deal with hazardous, financial, operational, and strategic risks.

Name: Determine risk tolerance for organization
Element Description: Recognizing the organization's tolerance for risk, given risk-return trade-offs for one or more anticipated and predictable consequences.

Name: Develop and maintain enterprise risk policies and procedures
Element Description: Establishing and maintaining the policies and procedures for managing risk. Create rules and regulations for enterprise risk dealing with hazardous, financial, operational, and strategic risks.

Name: Identify and implement enterprise risk management tools
Element Description: Recognizing and implementing tools for managing risk. Identify and apply enterprise risk management tools. Leverage methods and processes to manage risks and opportunities associated with business objectives.

Name: Coordinate the sharing of risk knowledge across the organization
Element Description: Communicating the knowledge about risk within the organization. Identify operational risks. Share risk information within the organization.

Name: Prepare and report enterprise risk to executive management and board
Element Description: Preparing and presenting reports about enterprise risk to the management of the organization. Create reports for management on hazard risks (e.g., property damage and liability torts), financial risks (e.g., currency and liquidity risks), and operational risks (e.g., product failure, customer satisfaction, social trends, and competition).

Name: Oversee and coordinate enterprise risk management activities
Element Description: Coordinating to plan, organize, lead, and control the activities of an organization in order to minimize the special effects of risk on capital and earnings.

Name: Identify enterprise level risks
Element Description: Determining risks that could thwart objectives. Document and communicate the concern.

Name: Assess risks to determine which to mitigate
Element Description: Identifying options/actions to enhance opportunities and reduce threats. Recognize the root reasons of the identified risks.

Name: Develop risk mitigation and management strategy and integrate with existing performance management processes
Element Description: Developing activities to improve opportunities and lessen threats. Specify the organization's objectives. Evolve strategies and policies to attain these objectives. Assign resources to project objectives.

Name: Verify business unit and functional risk mitigation plans are implemented
Element Description: Checking that the blueprint created for managing risk in individual business units and divisions is correctly effectuated. Validate the implementation of all activities geared to mitigate risks.

Name: Ensure risks and risk mitigation actions are monitored
Element Description: Ensuring risk monitoring and mitigation activities. Monitor actions to enhance opportunities and reduce threats to project objectives.

Name: Report on enterprise risk activities
Element Description: Creating a report of activities to address hazard risks, liability torts, financial risks, operational risks, social trends, competition, etc.

Name: Coordinate business unit and functional risk management activities
Element Description: Coordinating risk management activities to improve opportunities and lessen threats. Specify the organization's objectives. Assign resources to project objectives.

Name: Ensure that each business unit/function follows the enterprise risk management process
Element Description: Checking each business unit's/function's options and activities to improve opportunities and lessen threats.

Name: Ensure that each business unit/function follows the enterprise risk reporting process
Element Description: Checking the reporting process of each business unit's/function's options and activities to improve opportunities and lessen threats.

Name: Manage business unit and function risk
Element Description: Analyzing the threats a business unit/function faces to prioritize the controls it implements..

Name: Identify risks
Element Description: Developing a timely and continuous process to identify activities that might hinder a project's goals.

Name: Assess risks using enterprise risk framework policies and procedures
Element Description: Determining the possibility that a specified undesirable event will occur using established tools, implements, and frameworks. Use risk assessments to determine, for example, whether to undertake a particular venture, what rate of return a particular investment requires, and how to mitigate an activity's potential losses.

Name: Develop mitigation plans for risks
Element Description: Developing possibilities and arrangements to improve opportunities and reduce deviations to project objectives.

Name: Assess adequacy of insurance coverage
Element Description: Evaluating the changing needs for insurance coverage. Research available insurance providers and offerings.

Name: Implement mitigation plans for risks
Element Description: Executing mitigation plans to improve opportunities and reduce deviations to project objectives.

Name: Monitor risks
Element Description: Identifying, examining, and recognizing/justifying any improbability in investment decision making.

Name: Analyze risk activities and update plans
Element Description: Examining the impact of risk activities in order to update the existing scheme of risk management. Analyze and substantiate the potential for adverse consequences to occur. Consider the risks associated with the activity and the methods available to manage those risks.

Name: Report on risk activities
Element Description: Creating reports on risk activities, and communicating them to management. Prepare reports on the potential for adverse safety consequences.

Name: Manage compliance
Element Description: Managing steps to confirm enduring compliance to industry regulations and government legislation.

Name: Establish compliance framework and policies
Element Description: Developing a set of procedures detailing an organization's progress in complying with established guidelines, provisions, and legislation.

Name: Develop enterprise compliance policies and procedures
Element Description: Creating a standardized approach to ethics and compliance. Have a programmatic approach for compliance that focuses on the definite risks the organization faces.

Name: Implement enterprise compliance activities
Element Description: Implementing standardized for ethics and compliance. Have a programmatic approach, built from the top down, to enterprise compliance that focuses on the definite risks the organization faces.

Name: Manage internal audits
Element Description: Managing accounts and prepare regular reports on financial performance.

Name: Maintain controls-related technologies and tools
Element Description: Managing technologies and tools related to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data in order to ensure the security of the organization's information.

Name: Manage regulatory compliance
Element Description: Obeying laws, guidelines, strategies, and stipulations related to the business.

Name: Develop regulatory compliance procedures
Element Description: Developing procedures and methodologies to comply with relevant laws and regulations of an organization's obedience to laws, guidelines, strategies and stipulations related to business.

Name: Identify applicable regulatory requirements
Element Description: Determining the regulatory requirements that are most appropriate for the organization. Identify goals in order to follow the appropriate rules and regulations, guidelines, and strategies.

Name: Monitor the regulatory environment for changing or emerging regulations
Element Description: Analyzing and overseeing the regulatory environment in order to spot any changing or emerging regulations. This process element calls upon the organization to monitor the regulatory environment for any new statutes, policies, and enactments issued by the respective government authorities or those which have been updated.

Name: Assess current compliance position and identify weaknesses or shortfalls therein
Element Description: Evaluating current regulatory policies and regulations. Assess their performance. Make necessary changes.

Name: Implement missing or stronger regulatory compliance controls and policies
Element Description: Assessing the current policies and policies. Implement missing and necessary changes environmental changes, political changes, technological changes, etc.

Name: Monitor and test regulatory compliance position and existing controls
Element Description: Monitoring, appraising, and evaluating the compliance position of the organization in order to fine-tune for effective remediation. Track efforts for handling regulatory and compliance requirements necessitated by law. Test the robustness of internal frameworks, procedures, and approaches for dealing with these requirements, in order to clearly identify any necessary changes.

Name: Compile and communicate compliance scorecard(s)
Element Description: Creating a graphical representation of metrics in order to communicate the general health of the organization in relation to risk and compliancy.

Name: Compile and communicate internal and regulatory compliance reports
Element Description: Submitting compliance reports to regulatory agencies. These reports can be made to environmental, securities, or human resources agencies as stipulated by the local governing body.

Name: Maintain relationships with regulators as appropriate
Element Description: Developing and preserving relationships with the regulators, without compromising the legal basis of the relationship.

Name: Manage remediation efforts
Element Description: Administering the efforts and activities for remediation. This process element requires the organization to create plans for corrective action in collaboration with government agencies and pertinent professional services agencies which specialize in remediation efforts relevant to the organization's operations. Additionally, the organization needs to consult experts to validate the plan, determine resources allocation, resolve any legal concerns, and formulate a company-wide policy for remediation.

Name: Create remediation plans
Element Description: Creating plans for remediation efforts. Make a plan to address a case of environmental adulteration. Identify and treat the adulteration so that the area will become operational again.

Name: Contact and confer with experts
Element Description: Discussing and soliciting advice from experts for in order to incorporate their suggestion (regarding Create remediation plans [11201]).

Name: Identify/dedicate resources
Element Description: Identifying and dedicating the resources for managing remediation efforts. Discern the resources needed for remediation efforts. Dispense with resources in a sound and well-reasoned manner.

Name: Investigate legal aspects
Element Description: Examining regulatory and legislative frameworks. Obligate the organization to remediate any damages through compensations, fines, and any other remedial efforts necessitated to correct the situations. Analyze local environmental laws, binding international covenants, etc. in order to examine legal accuracy about the rules and procedures.

Name: Investigate damage cause
Element Description: Studying the causes of damage, which could be environmental, physical, social, etc. at country level in order to institute better policies and regulations.

Name: Amend or create policy
